loans.use: buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Assaf

texts.en:
Assaf is 19 years old.  He lives with his family in Gaza.  He has a store selling a school products and earns a monthly income $600.  He started his business at the first of November 2011.

Assaf needs this youth loan to buy a printer machine and new school products.  Assaf  is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.  His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, and he hopes that someday to restart his education over again.

loans.use: buy a printer and school products

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 28 years old.  He lives with his parents in Fara camp at Nablus, one of the camps established after the Palestinian Nakba, in an area of 225,000 square meters.

Ibraheem is asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house and structure doors and windows.  He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house and make it better, which will able them to live in with more psychological comfort.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him

loans.use: to buy flagstones to improve his house

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is a mother of three kids and is in her late 40s.  She resides in Kampong Cham province and is a local farmer who strives for a living via rice farming. To earn more income, her husband works for others for a fee at construction sites. This is the first loan for Neang with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner).  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a cow for raising and to support her rice farming. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from this cow-raising business so that she can gain a good income to buy pigs to supplement her income.

loans.use: buy a cow

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tajat

texts.en:
Tajat is an experienced farmer from village of Jigrasheni in Ninotsminda district. He has a wife and a student daughter. His wife is a housekeeper and is a hard-worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs, especially their daughter's education. 

Tajat's family is involved in agricultural activities, in particular they have 5 cattle and cultivate potatoes on their agricultural land. Tajat sells the harvested potatoes to the local market and monthly generates approximately 700 GEL. He has great desire to improve his agricultural activity, buy milk cows and sell their products locally, and also to supply food for the animals. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $3000. Tajat and his family is thankful to all lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: buy dairy cows and livestock feed

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is from the village of Nasakirali in the western part of Georgia. He is 29 years, married and has two sons (2 and 7 years old). The young family runs a  small-scale agricultural business to earn a living. Specifically, they grow citrus, maize and potatoes on their own plot of land and sell the harvest periodically.

In order to increase his family monthly income, Zviad plans to start a new business. With the received loan amount, he will start a shoe sales business in his district. Zviad will hire the commercial space and buy stocks of winter shoes at wholesale prices. He will sell the items for a profit himself and generate income.  He is inexperienced in the trading business and  hopes he will have a successful project due to his hard work.  Zviad hopes this Kiva loan will be helpful for his family.

loans.use: to start a shoe sales business

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 49-year-old married woman from the small village in Lagodekhi district. She lives with her husband, 26-year-old son, and pensioner mother-in-law. Mzia works at the dining hall of the local school.  She prepares dishes and rolls for children. Her son works as a security guard and gets 225 Gels per month.  Her husband is unemployed. 

Mzia requested a loan though the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  This program enables her to get a loan of $3400 to purchase a car.  After the car is purchased, her husband will serve the local people as a taxi driver to generate income. With the increased income, Mzia will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a car for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Thy Will Be Group

texts.en:
Please meet members of the Thy Will Be Group from Dansoman, a fast-growing business area in Accra, Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to ID Ghana, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of GHS 3,900 to supplement their capital. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Nelly is the featured leader of this group. The 41-year-old woman is married to a trader and they have three children. Nelly has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She sells clothing and slippers. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of clothing and slippers to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothing and slippers to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anjuma

texts.en:
Anjuma is a 26-year-old woman, married to Minu, age 32. They live in Magurmari village in a small town, Dhupguri. They have four daughters. Two of them are in class III (grade 3) and class I (grade 1) in school, and the other two are below school-going age. Anjuma studied up to class IV (grade 4), and her husband is literate and studied up to class VII (grade 7). They stay in a kaccha house (straw and mud-made) in the remote area.

Her husband is a green grocer who is struggling for his family throughout the day. So, Anjuma is also trying to help her husband financially. She has an animal husbandry business and covers some of their home expenses. But still, their expenditures are so high that she is unable to compensate for it. 

So, she decided to help her own business flourish, so that it might be possible for her to fight for her family’s well-being. She learned about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and applied for a loan of 14,000 INR to buy a cow. She will start a business in dairy products, such as milk, butter, paneer, curd, etc. She will sell them in the local market, where there is a great demand for these products. 

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for a new dairy business.

loans.name: Giuliana

texts.en: Giuliana is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handmade filigree jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of sterling silver for her designs. Giuliana has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story: "As a child, I loved creating my own jewelry to wear at parties, or to give as gifts to friends. My designs speak of tradition yet are modern, and they feature the harmony between metal, pearls and gemstones. I'd like to show the world the handcrafted filigree styles developed in Peru over the centuries. I have researched the theme at length and my findings have led me to experiment with many great materials. Andean opal is my favorite." "I am really grateful to everyone who is assisting us, as this micro-credit will help us keep developing this art, which is our passion and our lifestyle. The effort that we dedicate to each and every piece of jewelry is rewarded when you choose it." Use the link below to view Giuliana's silver filigree jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4994

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sterling silver for her designs.

loans.name: Buana

texts.en: Balinese artisan Buana specializes in handmade jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones for production. Buana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: "I've been surrounded by handicrafts all my life. I am thankful to God for giving me such a great gift so I can make a living for my family. Not much, perhaps, but enough for our simple way of life." "With your support through this microcredit loan, I'll be able to prepare a good stock for this holiday season. I would like to send my thanks to all of you for this opportunity because it will make make my sales grow. I also hope you like my handcrafted jewelry - I will be very happy if one of my creations becomes a part of your daily joy." Use the link below to view Buana's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5503

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones for production.

loans.name: Maragret

texts.en: Margaret is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She has one additional family member, a grandchild. She sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 12 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start selling food stuff. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Made

texts.en: Made is a Balinese artisan who specializes in sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of gemstones and silver for production. Made has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story: "I recall how I learned the silversmith art from a family member. He taught me after school and at that time, the tools we used were still very traditional. I first learned to hammer silver by hand and sometimes I'd miss and hit my hand! When I was learning to place tiny silver granules, I'd fall asleep. But I was eventually able to craft earrings by myself. Then I learned to design my own items and my dream is to see my jewelry worn by people around the world." "I would like for my business to grow well. Right now I need to prepare the stock that I should provide during the holiday season. With this microcredit from you, I will buy the silver and gems to craft my designs. Thank you." Use the link below to view Made's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7147

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of gemstones and silver for production.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego is a Guatemalan artisan who carves Maya masks and images of saints. He'd like to invest in sustainably harvested pinewood, paints and sandpaper as well as saws for his workshop. Diego has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: "I am a Maya woodcarver. At 10, I left school to help my father work in the fields. Eventually I began selling wooden masks, then learned to carve and paint them, while still helping my father. A devout Catholic, I then began carving images of saints. Today, I have taught this art to six people, and have been able to put my children, who are also wood carvers, through school. I am also an accomplished folk dancer." "I'm very grateful for your help and support. I also appreciate your purchases of my sculptures — this helps me continue working and give a better life to my family and to the artisans who work with me. Many thanks!" Use the link below to view Diego's wood sculptures and masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7299

loans.use: to invest in sustainably harvested pinewood, paints and sandpaper as well as saws for his workshop.

loans.name: Nengah

texts.en: Nengah is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handwoven handbags and home accessories. He would like to invest in the purchase of ate grass (his prime material) and in production costs. Nengah has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: "My mother is a senior 'ate' grass weaver in our village. My grandfather taught me to print Balinese handwriting on palm leaves as well as carving images on this leaf. When demand grew for ate products, I saw it as a challenge to learn how to make these too. Weaving this durable island grass is not as hard as people may think, but it's not an easy work either. One needs a lot of patience to weave one tiny piece of ate into a basket or bag." "I would like to increase my stock of finished items and have it ready for this holiday season. Your microcredit will go towards making this possible, and it will make it easier for me to pay the weavers who work with me. Thanks for your support, you make it possible for me able to continue this kind of a weaving art, especially because this style of weaving is already rare and it is difficult to get the specific material." Use the link below to view Nengah's handwoven ate grass handbags and home decor on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3687

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ate grass (his prime material) and in production costs.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad, de Huacho con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante y superarse; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Carlos se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Informática.
Por iniciativa propia, Carlos trabaja como asistente informático en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas,Carlos se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de reparación de su laptop, ya que necesita tenerla operativa para usarla en sus estudios, así pues Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 23-year-old man, single and lives in the city of Huacho with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and dedicates all his effort to getting ahead and excelling. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Carlos is studying a for professional career in computer science. Through his own initiative, Carlos works as a computer assistant in a municipal business in the city. He works every day from the early morning hours for about 8 hours. Carlos enjoys working and believes that his work has been going well because of his dedication and strong performance. 

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support he will be able to cover the repair expenses for his laptop, which he needs for his studies. Carlos will continue working and pushing himself to succeed in his dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to repair his laptop

loans.name: Kelin

texts.es:
La señora Kelin  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con sus hijos y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de  8 años. 
Doña  Kelin el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca,  arroz,  frijoles, carnes y pollo, refrescos etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña  Kelin espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona, y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijos   ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos 	


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Diciembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Kelin is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person. She lives with her children and husband in the south of Honduras. She has had a grocery business for more than 8 years.

Kelin needs the loan to buy shortening, rice, beans, meat and chicken, soft drinks, etc. She hopes that sales at her business will increase with the loan upon having more product to offer and serving her customers better.

Kelin hopes to cover the needs she has and improve the quality of life a bit for herself and her family. In a few years, she hopes that her business will continue to grow and become one of the largest and most well-known in the area, and will continue to support her parents and children, since they have few economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: to buy shortening, rice, beans, meat and chicken, soft drinks, etc., for her business

loans.name: Miselida

texts.es: Misélida, de 61 años, esta divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, vive únicamente con Diana de 38 años en su casa propia que pudo comprar con bastante esfuerzo y muchos años de ahorro. Misélida es una mujer emprendedora y con visión de negocio, ya que desarrolla ampliamente varios trabajos de acuerdo a la temporada, entre las actividades que realiza principalmente se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, en tamaño, marca y presentación, hace sus pedidos al por mayor, para después venderlos entre los vecinos y algunos ocasionales clientes que pasan por su casa, para cumplir esta función tiene un espacio en su casa donde ha acondicionado diversas sillas y mesas junto a un congelador. Realiza esta labor hace 5 años. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un bar bien complementado, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad, por que actualmente solo lo hace por las tardes, aunque ya ha ganado experiencia en éste trabajo siente que todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene; no obstante espera que todo el esfuerzo que realiza produzca buenos frutos como hasta ahora ya que lo único que desea es seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.3800; en está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará  bebidas de distintas marcas y sabores para tener buen stock en su negocio y así poder satisfacer a los pedidos de todos clientes quienes son muy exigentes.
texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old Misélida is divorced and has four children, all now independent adults. Misélida lives only with one daughter, 38-year-old Diana. Misélida  owns the house, having bought it after much effort and a lot of saving. Misélida  is an enterprising woman with a good head for business. She works at her different jobs according to the season. Of all her jobs, her main one is selling drinks of all types and brands. She buys in bulk to then sell the drinks to neighbours and passers-by. Misélida has a space in her house set up with chairs and tables, and a freezer. Misélida has been doing this work for five years.

In the future, Misélida hopes to have a well-stocked bar where she can sell all day. She currently works only in the afternoon. Although Misélida has experience in this work, she still finds it difficult to serve all of her customers. Nonetheless she hopes that all of her efforts are fruitful - as they have been up to now - as all Misélida wants to do is prosper.

On this occasion Misélida is applying for a loan of 1800 Nuevo Soles. She is very happy knowing that she will have financial backing because, with it, she feels more secure as she moves forward with her business.  Misélida promises, once again, to make her repayments on time. Misélida will use this loan to buy drinks of various brands and flavours in order to have good stock levels and to fulfil all of her demanding customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Norma Jamileth

texts.es:
La señora Doris es una persona emprendedora, honesta y seria, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo, en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la compra y venta de semillas.
Doña Doris el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de semillas de maní, con el préstamo espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar su situación económica. 
Doña Doris espera que a un corto plazo siga creciendo y consolidándose para que se convierta en el más grande y reconocido de la región y seguir apoyando a su familia para que su hijo se conviertan en una persona honesta con principios y valores. 



Choluteca, Honduras  – Diciembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Doris is an enterprising, honest, and trustworthy person.  She is a single mother; she lives with her child in the southern part of Honduras.  Her business is purchasing and selling seeds.  Doña Doris needs this loan to buy peanut seed.  She hopes that with this loan her sales will increase.  In this way she can have more stock to offer her customers and cover their needs, and so can improve her economic situation.

Doña Doris hopes that in the short term she can keep growing and establishing herself so that she can become a bigger business, well-known throughout the area.  She can keep supporting her family so that her child can become an honest person with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: to buy peanut seeds for her business.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is a 28-year-old, married man who lives in the village of Gamarjveba, in Dedoflistskaro district. He has wife and two little children. The only source of income for this four-member family is Mamuka's job, working as a herdsman. He gets GEL 8 for each head of cattle. 

As the family's needs are growing with time, Mamuka wants to start his own agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the family's needs. So, he requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of GEL 2,300 to purchase cattle. Mamuka will raise them and sell them at a good price. 

With the increased income, Mamuka will improve the living conditions of his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more palm leaves for her business. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for her mat-weaving business.

loans.name: Shamila

texts.en:
Shamila is a 27-year-old married woman with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells cocoa from her garden, and rice. She has been in the business for six years. Her main aim of starting this business was to increase her income and educate her children. Seasonality changes and lack of enough capital hinder her work. 

Shamila is in need of a loan to buy rice and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Suyapa Maribel

texts.es:
La  joven Suyapa una persona emprendedora,  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y su hijo   en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ropa  y calzado americano.
Suyapa el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y calzado.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económica. 
Suyapa  espera que  a un corto plazo   su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la región y seguir  apoyando a su familia y que su hijo y se convierta  en una persona honesta  con principios y valores.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Diciembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Suyapa is a young woman, very enterprising, honest, and trustworthy.  She lives with her husband and her child in southern Honduras.  Her business is buying and selling American clothing and footwear.

Suyapa needs this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and footwear.  She hopes that with the loan the sales in her business will increase as she has more merchandise to offer her customers and meet their needs.  With this she can improve her own financial situation.

Suyapa hopes that in the short term her business will keep growing and establishing itself so that it can become a larger business, well-known in the area.  She can keep supporting her family and her child can become an honest person with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and footwear for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, tiene 30 años, está casada con David y tiene una hija de 07 años, actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su familia. Carmen dedica su tiempo laboral principalmente a la venta de repuestos, piezas y accesorios para todo tipo de vehículos, básicamente para mototaxis, asimismo realiza funciones de mantenimiento y reparaciones de mototaxis que presentan algunas deficiencias en su funcionamiento y gracias a la excelente calidad con la que realiza su trabajo es considerada como una de las mejores en éste rubro y se ha convertido en una de las más conocidas de la ciudad, fama que comparte con su esposo David. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver que sus clientes se sienten contentos cuando observan que los vehículos terminan en buenas condiciones y funcionando a la perfección, satisfacción que conoce y comparte de cerca ya que también tiene 2 mototaxis. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 2500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado incrementará sus repuestos, piezas, accesorios y herramientas en su taller, entre ellos: cámaras, rodajes, llantas, pernos, aceites entre otros, de distintas marcas.
texts.en: Carmen is 30 years old, is married to David and has a seven-year-old daughter.  She live in her own home with her family.  Carmen works primarily selling parts and accessories for all kinds of vehicles, mainly motorcycle taxis.  She also does maintenance and repairs for motorcycle taxis that are having problems running.  Thanks to the excellent quality of her work she is considered to be one of the best in this field, and has become one of the best known in the city, along with her husband David.  The thing that she likes best about her work is seeing her customers happy when they see that their vehicles end up in good condition and working perfectly.  She knows and shares this satisfaction, because she also owns 2 motorcycle taxis.   She is requesting a loan of 2,500 PEN, and is grateful for the opportunity and the trust placed in her to receive this loan.  For her part, she commits to making her payments punctually.  With the amount requested she will add to the parts, accessories and tools in her workshop, including inner tubes, wheels, tires, bolts, and oil, among other things, from different brands.

loans.use: to buy parts and accessories for cars.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
This is Luvuno. She previously accessed a loan that she used to stock her food stall business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Luvuno would like to apply for a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 52 years old and widowed twice with three children (ages 33, 29 and 21).  Her daughter is a lawyer, her oldest son is an engineer, and her youngest son is currently studying in University and helps her with her business.  She graduated from 6th Grade Primary School before she started working.  Herminia is a professional seamstress that has been successfully managing her small business in Ciudad Vieja in the Sacatepéquez region of Guatemala.  Her top-selling items are dresses for the first communion and for ‘Quinceañeras´ (a traditional 15th birthday celebration).  She is a very hard-working and dedicated woman, who managed to raise her children and grow her business by herself.  Her dream is to travel to the United States of America to explore a different world.

Herminia wants to invest her loan money in two new sewing machines, fabric, accessories, and mannequins.  She is very innovative when it comes to new strategies, and wants to explore new markets and products, such as special covers for chairs.  She also wants to hire two full-time employees and open her store in a different setting in order to have more space.  It is the size and scope of what she is trying to do that make her an exceptional candidate for the advanced training and larger loan sizes of the Namaste STARZ program.

The STARZ program is unique in the world of microfinance as the loan repayments are tied to the profits of the borrower instead of being fixed payments.  Since loan payments are linked to profits, borrowers are able to ride out business cycles or other unforeseen events.  Through the STARZ program, high potential women receive intensive business coaching bi-weekly over two to three years.  They also receive a formal six-month education in financial literacy and business operations that leads to a diploma in Small and Medium Enterprise Management by the Guatemalan Technical Institute for Training and Productivity (INTECAP).  Credit is not generally available to women with businesses of this size, so an important program element is an appropriately-sized business loan.  Women also receive coaching in leadership, economic and gender empowerment, and renegotiating household power relationships.  By working with Fundación Namaste Guatemaya, the STARZ participant and her business advisor have a continuous-loop, real-time monitoring, evaluation and learning system.  

By the end of Herminia’s first loan cycle with Fundación Namaste Guatemaya, she had increased her profits by 120% to around $540 US per month.  Her goal in the STARZ Program is to increase her monthly profits to approximately $970 US in the next year.  To do this, she has requested this loan of 30,000 Guatemalan Quetzales, with repayments over 36 months.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines, fabric, accessories, and mannequins.

loans.name: Macaria Angelica

texts.en:
Macaria is 42 years old and married with 4 daughters.  Her eldest is 18, her youngest is 12, and she has 14-year-old twins.  Her eldest daughter graduated from high school and her younger children are still enrolled in middle school.  Her husband is a craftsman and supports their family both economically and emotionally. They are a united family, which offers the perfect support for her business and their dreams of owning their own house.

Macaria runs a bookstore in Jocotenango, close to Antigua, Guatemala.  She is an experienced business woman who was the owner of a clothing business in past years.  A while back she started looking for a new challenge and after analyzing the market in her neighborhood, she opened her new enterprise and received the support of two loans and personalized business education provided by Fundación Namaste Guatemaya. 

She wants to invest her loan money of 25,000 Guatemalan Quetzales in more stock for her bookstore, such as notebooks, markers, crayons, and construction paper, in order to serve the high demand from schools and universities in her neighborhood.  When she started her first loan cycle, she had a storefront and worked 183 hours per month.  She had an estimated monthly profit of 563 Quetzales, or approximately $70 US.  By the end of the first loan cycle, she increased her profits by 111% to approximately $150 US.  Macaria is now aiming towards a monthly profit of around $1300 US by the end of this upcoming loan cycle in 30 months. 

Her ideas regarding new strategies in order to achieve her goals include setting up a proper sign outside her bookstore and improving her publicity.  She is also considering the possibility of buying or renting a photo copy machine.  It is the size and scope of what she is trying to do that make her an exceptional candidate for the advanced training and larger loan size of the Namaste STARZ program.

The STARZ program is unique in the world of microfinance as the loan repayments are tied to the profits of the borrower instead of being fixed payments.  Since loan payments are linked to profits, borrowers are able to ride out business cycles or other unforeseen events.  Through the STARZ program, high potential women receive intensive business coaching bi-weekly over two to three years.  They also receive a formal six-month education in financial literacy and business operations that leads to a diploma in Small and Medium Enterprise Management by the Guatemalan Technical Institute for Training and Productivity (INTECAP).  Credit is not generally available to women with businesses of this size, so an important program element is an appropriately-sized business loan.  Women also receive coaching in leadership, economic and gender empowerment, and renegotiating household power relationships.  By working with Fundación Namaste Guatemaya, the STARZ participant and her business advisor have a continuous-loop, real-time monitoring, evaluation and learning system.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her bookstore, such as notebooks, markers, crayons, and construction paper

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal, es soltero, de 29 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad y estudiantes, el junto a su familia vive en San Antonio Palopó, Sololá. Se dedica a la compraventa de bisutería (artículos hechos de mostacilla), lleva 9 años realizando esta labor la cual la aprendió de sus padres y otros familiares. 
La venta de este producto lo realiza en el municipio de San Lucas Tolimán (al sur de Sololá), a través de esta labor ella genera los ingresos con los cuales puede brindarles alimentación, ropa, vivienda y educación a sus hijos, lo que lo llena de mucha satisfacción.
Además de la compraventa de mostacilla, Cristóbal en sus días libres trabaja por jornal en la comunidad donde vive, lo que también le genera otros ingresos que complementan su presupuesto familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de más artículos de mostacilla para incrementar su mercadería.
Sueña con brindarles educación a sus hijos y en general mejorarle las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is single and 29-years old.  He has two dependent children who go to school.  He lives with his family in San Antonio Palopó, Sololá.  Cristóbal  makes his living buying and selling costume jewelry (beaded items).  He has been in this line of work for 9 years.  He learned it from his parents and other family members.  
Cristóbal sells his merchandise in the town of San Lucas Tolimán (to the south of Sololá).  Through his work, Cristóbal earns enough to provide his children with food, clothing, housing and schooling, which fills him with a great deal of satisfaction. 
In addition to buying and selling beaded jewelry, Cristóbal uses his days off to work as a day laborer in the community he lives in.  This provides another source of income to supplement his family's finances. 
Cristóbal is requesting a loan of Q 6,000.00 (USD $775) to purchase additional beaded items to increase his supply of merchandise. 
He hopes to provide his children with an education and, in general, to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more beaded items to increase his supply of merchandise.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta el noveno grado convive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos.  Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos  a quienes enviá a la escuela mientras él trabaja  como motorista y su esposa se dedica comercializar gallinas indias; juntos llevan el sustento a sus hijos.

Ricardo  se dedica a trabajar como motorista y en su tiempo libre a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, desde pequeño y lo cual le genera ingresos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para arreglar su vehículo,  con el cual  realiza viajes  ya que por ser motorista lo buscan y le toca alquilar uno, lo que le genera pocos ingresos.

Ricardo planea en un futuro, poder comprar vacas lecheras para producir leche y poder vender queso, crema, entre otros productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 55 years old and has a ninth grade education. He lives with his wife and two children. He gets up at 5 a.m. together with his wife and children whom he sends to school. While he works as a driver, his wife markets indian hens; together they support their children. Ricardo makes a living as a driver and in his free time he works in agriculture, a trade that he learned from his parents when he was small to generate income.

The loan he requests from Fundación Campo is to fix his vehicle, which he uses to carry out trips. When his customers seek out his services, having to rent a vehicle generates less income for him. In the future, Ricardo plans to buy dairy cows to produce milk and sell cheese and cream, as well as other dairy products.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ropolon Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the Tamaraneh Ropolon group. These people are small-scale entrepreneurs who are applying together for a 2,500,000 SLL loan. The loan will be apportioned equally among the group’s members to be invested in their respective businesses.

Chernor is the featured leader of this group. He is 37, married and has four children who are attending primary and secondary school. Chernor sells fried food, ataya (Chinese green tea) and cooked beans. With his 500,000 SLL share of this loan, he is going to expand his business by buying cartons of ataya, sugar at wholesale, beans, oil, and other cooking ingredients.

loans.use: to buy cartons of ataya, sugar, beans, oil and other cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
Ablaye est un jeune mareyeur qui a hérité le métier de son père, qui l’été aussi. Il a obtenu le permis en 2007 et a acquis un camion frigorifique qu’il conduit lui-même et fait des livraisons vers des zones éloignées. C’est depuis 2010 qu’il travaille pour son propre compte et part jusqu’en  Casamance pour écouler le produit. Ablaye a besoin d’un crédit de 300000F pour acheter du gasoil, de la glace pour congeler les poissons.
Ablaye est marié et père de deux enfants. Il s’occupe de leurs besoins quotidiens et de leur éducation. Quand il doit partir en voyage, il laisse la dépense nécessaire pour tout le temps qu’il sera absent  à son épouse.
L’activité est rentable, mais lente, c’est pourquoi, Ablaye pense acheter un autre véhicule pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ablaye is a young wholesale fishmonger who learned the business from his father. He obtained his permit in 2007 and purchased a refrigerator truck, which he uses to make deliveries in remote areas. He branched out on his own in 2010, traveling to Casamance to sell his stock. He is seeking a loan of 300,000F to purchase diesel fuel and some ice to preserve the fish.

Ablaye is married with two children. He provides for their day-to-day needs and their education. When he has to travel for his work, he leaves his wife enough money to cover expenses in his absence. 

Since Ablaye’s business is profitable but slow, he feels that in the long term, he might want to purchase another vehicle to help bolster his activity.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel and ice for his delivery truck to transport his stock of fish.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES15,000 to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

10 years ago, Kadiatu established her timber business. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that at present, her business is doing well.

Kadiatu requires a loan to buy more timber to sell.  

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. 

After her wedding, Mariatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is price inflation and a proper business location.

Mariatu requires a loan to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business. 

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es: Vanesa, de 35 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia hace 08 años junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 04 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Vanesa se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, adicionalmente a esto vende gaseosas, hielo y helados con los que también genera el dinero necesario para la alimentación y el pago de algunos gastos propios del día, mientras que su esposo aporta el dinero que obtiene trabajando como chofer del mototaxi que también ella pudo comprar con algunos ahorros. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y puede mantenerse en reposo, manteniendo controlada su salud ya que hace un tiempo el doctor le recomendó descanso médico, le agrada el ritmo con el que va creciendo su puesto de venta de abarrotes. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2000, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, leche, azúcar, entre otros, además de algunas bebidas y helados.
texts.en:
Vanesa, age 35, is married.  She has lived in her own house for eight years, together with her husband and two children, ages 4 and 16 years.  She hopes to give her children a better quality of life.  Vanesa works selling grocery products.  Besides this, she also sells soda, ice and ice cream.  With this, she makes the money she needs to eat and to pay for some of her own expenses, while her husband contributes with the money he earns from driving a mototaxi that Vanesa managed to buy with some savings.  

What she likes most about her work is that it isn’t terribly taxing, and she can rest, keeping control of her health, because a while back her doctor recommended medical rest.  She is pleased with the pace at which her grocery stand is growing.  

Right now she is asking for 2,000 soles.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support, because she feels safer moving forward with her business.  At the same time she is once again committed to making her payments on time.  With the loan she will buy grocery products such as rice, milk, and sugar, among others.  She will also buy some drinks and ice cream products.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, milk, and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Balqiss Group

texts.en:
The name of this group of four hard-working women is Balqiss. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Our featured borrower is Balgees, a 43-year-old married woman living in a poor area in Sana'a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed.

Balgees is therefore is applying for a portion of this loan to be used to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house. She is happy and grateful for Kiva’s support, as in this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Samkumba

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Samkumba from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with one child. In 2007, SamKumba established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to educate her child. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Samkumba requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Samkumba plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is hard-working and enterprising.  She lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es: José, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene un hijo, reside en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Anteriormente trabajó en una tienda con un hermano. El tiene 14 meses de haber establecido su negocio en un local del mercado, vende ropa como camisas, camisetas, pantalones, sandalias, achinería y  zapatos. El préstamo que solicita es por 12,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá, en la compra de mas ropa como camisetas y tenis para vender. Con este préstamo va tener mas surtido su negocio y va aprovechar la temporada navideña. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
José,24, lives with his wife and their one son. They live in the Tela Atlántida municipality. 

Previously he worked in a store with one of his brothers. 

He established his business 14 months ago in a stall in the market where he sells clothing such as shits, blouses, pants, sandals, knicknacks and shoes. 

He is requesting a loan for 12,000 HNL [$600] to invest in more clothes such as blouses and sneakers to sell. 

With this loan he will have a bigger selection and will be able to take advantage of the Christmas season. 

His goal is to grow his business and to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as blouses and sneakers to sell.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Marcelline est une dame âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'age varie entre 15 et 24 ans. comme activité, elle dispose d'un comptoir sur lequel elle vend des tomates, de l'huile raffinée, des arachides, du manioc sec et bien d'autres produits alimentaires. elle mène cette activité depuis 5 ans déjà, ceci dit elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle voudrait ce crédit acheter quelques cajots de tomates pour augmenter son stock afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle grandissante durant la période de  fête. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Marcelline is a 46-year-old woman who is married with 3 children between the ages of 15 and 24. Her business is managing a stall where she sells tomatoes, refined oil, peanuts, dried cassava and other food products. She has been in this business for 5 years so far, which means she now has significant experience in this area.

Marcelline would like this loan to be able to purchase crates of tomatoes to increase her stock, in order to better meet the needs of her growing customer base during the festival season. The profits she earns will allow her to better provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is married, with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past one year, she has operated a business of selling leso cloth (women's wrap).  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of lesos (women's wrap)  for resale

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is a very hard-working and enterprising.  She says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour, and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 34 años casada,y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es chofer de buses de transporte colectivo, en Santiago Sac, doña Victoria lleva ya 7 años  de vender ropa típica empezó vendiendo unas cuantas blusas y cortes usados, ahora tiene un local, frente a su casa, donde vende ropa de primera, compra cada 15 días mercadería, y tiene clientes fijos a quienes le vende por abonos, ahora también para aprovechar el local vende  verduras frijol y maíz, y algunas golosinas, ya es conocida, la buscan por los precios y facilidades de pago, está feliz porque con cada crédito a logrado hacer algo, mejorar su hogar y su negocio, espera seguir mejorando su local y ayudar a su esposo, esperando que ustedes le puedan seguir ayudando, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica para la venta.
texts.en:
Victoria, 34, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a bus driver in Santiago Sac. 

Victoria has been selling traditional clothing for the past seven years. 

She started selling a few used blouses and woven skirts. Now she has a store opposite her house where she sells new clothing. 

She buys merchandise every 15 days and she has regular customers who can pay her in installments. 

To take advantage of the store she also sells vegetables, beans, corn and some sweets. 

She is known and clients reach out to her for her prices and ease of payment. 

She is happy because with each loan she has been able to do something, improve her home and her business. 

She hopes to keep improving her store and to help her husband. 

She hopes you can keep helping her. She is asking for a loan to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cassava Group

texts.en:
Isatu, 36, is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni and has four children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary school. She sells cassava, plantains, yams, etc.

Isatu’s group is applying for a 2,500,000 SLL loan through SMT. She will use her 500,000 SLL share of the loan to buy cassava, plantains, yams, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cassava, plantains, yams, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Marie from Tombo in a western rural area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with four children.

For the past ten years Marie has operated a small grocery shop. She began her business because she wanted to contribute toward taking care of her children. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. six days a week. Inflation in prices is her main business challenge.

Marie is applying for a 900,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy drinks, pure water, soap and cooking seasonings for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.

In the future Marie plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks, pure water, soap and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Brenda Judith

texts.es:
La señora Brenda  es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y  responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace ya 7 años.
Doña Brenda su negocio funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de gran variedad de ropa como blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas, etc. y así seguir realizando su negocio.
Doña Brenda con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
Doña Brenda espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para  tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre del  2013
texts.en:
Brenda is a very hard working, modest and responsible woman who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family. For seven years she has made a living selling new clothing. 

Her business is operated from her home in the municipality where she lives. She needs the loan to buy a large variety of clothing including blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, and shirts to continue carrying out her business. 

Brenda hopes to increase her sales with the loan. This will be very useful for her because she does not have products in stock that are demanded by her customers to cover her orders. Thanks to this loan she will be able to improve her and her family's standard of living. 

Brenda hopes to grow her business in a short period of time. With this she will continue supporting her family so that her children have the education they need so that they can have better opportunities in their lives.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, and shirts for her business.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman and blessed with two children who go to school. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
 
Chinyavu has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gentlemen's suits for sale at home. She cites delayed payments and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenges. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Abigail de 51 años de edad,  esta casada y madre de una hija de 20 años de edad. Abigail estudio hasta noveno grado, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo e hija. Abigail se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo; durante todo el día trabaja en la parcela que cultiva y su hija se dedica a las labores domesticas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras, para poder producir leche para la venta y obtener un ingreso adicionales para el sustento de su familia.

Ella  planea comprar mas animales en un futuro, para  producir leche y elaborar queso para la venta.
texts.en:
Abigail, 51, is married and the mother of her 20 year old daughter. 

Abigail studied up to the 9th grade. 

Her husband is a farmer. She gets up at 4:30 am. 

Together with her husband and daughter she works in agriculture, a  trade she has learned from her husband. 

She works on the parcel that they cultivate all day and her daughter takes care of the house work. 

She is requesting a loan from  Fundación Campo to buy two milking cows in order to produce milk to sell for some additional income to help support the family. 

She plans on buying more animals in the future to produce milk and to make cheese for sale.

loans.use: to buy two milking cows to sell milk and earn some additional income to help support the family.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad, who appears in this photo, is a 44-year-old married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife and kids in a small simple house in the city. Jawad works as an employee in the public sector and he earns a low salary which is the only source of his family’s income. Jawad has a breathing problem and his doctor suggested a small surgery that will end this problem. He would like to do the surgery, but he does not have this money.

Jawad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him to pay the costs of doing a surgery in his nose. His loan will enable him to continue to easily do his daily activities.

loans.use: to pay the cost of doing a surgery in his nose

loans.name: Dúo San Rafael Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN RAFAEL
La seña Berta Consuelo, de 33 años, desde hace 5 años posee una Venta de Ropa Típica, ubicada dentro del Mercado de Chimaltenango, y que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y así mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio, ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña  Berta, es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA; con el préstamo quiere comprar Ropa Típica para niñas para seguir creciendo con su venta de Ropa.ahora que vienen las fiestas de fin de año y es cuando mas se vende.
texts.en:
DUO SAN RAFAEL

Berta Consuelo, 33, has sold traditional clothing for the past 5 years at the Chimaltenango Market. 

With effort she was able to establish herself and in this way improve her home. Through her business she has been able to support and get her family ahead. 
Berta's dream is to be able to improve the quality of life of her family through the micro credit  she is requesting from Kiva. 

With the loan she wants to buy traditional clothing for girls and to keep growing her business now that the end of year parties are on their way which is when there are the most sales.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for sale

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por apoyo brindado, ella continua vendiendo útiles como por ejemplo lapiceros, cuadernos, lápices, borradores, papeles, libros y otros cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos y libros, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is thankful to the lenders for her loan and she is happy with the support given. 

She continues selling school supplies  such as pens, notebooks, pencils, erasers, paper, books and other things. 

She is a very responsible person and for this reason she was invited to join the communal bank  “Señor de Coyllority”. 

At this time she is requesting a loan to buy notebooks and books. 

She appreciates and values the loan and is dedicated to pay the monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and books to sell.

loans.name: Muzayam

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Музаям. Ему 52 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 11  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Он должен провести свадебное торжество своего сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A kind person, who always tries to improve his living conditions and hopes for a bright future, needs financial support.  His name is Muzayam.  He is 52 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Because he lives in a rural area, he has a good opportunity to develop his animal husbandry business.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 11 years and has a lot of experience in this type of business.  He has to hold a wedding party for his son, but does not have money.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 US dollars to hold a wedding for his son.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding for his son

loans.name: Chikim Shg Group

texts.en:
“One has to have four arms, four legs, four eyes, two hearts, and double the love. There is nothing “single” about a single mom,” says Chinneng. After her husband passed away, she has been taking care of the family all alone. She is the featured borrower for Chikim Group and she is pictured with her hand raised. She also shares that she acts as a Doctor, a teacher, a nurse, a maid, a cook, a referee, a heroine, a provider, a defender, a protector, a true Superwoman. She says, " I wear my cape proudly". She and her friends co-operated, formed the group and named themselves Chikim, which means complete. 
  
Chinneng does all possible activities to make a living. She grows vegetables and raises chickens and pigs to generate extra income. Her main source of income is weaving. She weaves all traditional shawls and wrap around skirts and sells them in the village and nearby villages. Although weaving is her main activity for generating income, she cannot not afford to purchase a loom and expand her business. She is the sole breadwinner in the family and all the family burden is on her. This leaves only a small sum to invest in her weaving business.  She still weaves with the help of the traditional backstrap and it takes more time to finish.

With the assistance of the Kiva loan, she will purchase threads, yarns and other advanced tools for weaving. She is planning to generate more income, save money and purchase a loom. She says that with age, weaving with the help of the backstrap will be difficult and may cause health issues. She says, “Thank you Kiva” and she also says that she will always remain obliged for what they have done for her and the group.

The rest of the members are engaged in a piggery, weaving, a variety store, and a paan-corner.

loans.use: To purchase threads, yarns, other tools for weaving

loans.name: Sanaa'

texts.en:
Sanaa’ is a 55-year-old widow who lives in Nablus. In 2011 she started selling clothes and accessories in a rented shop so she could have a source of income she could rely on. She has worked hard to improve her business.

Sanaa’ is asking Ryada for a 2,000 USD loan to buy shelves and goods such as clothes and accessories to increase her stock. She hopes to be well-known in the market someday. Sanaa’ is very grateful to everyone who decides to help her achieve success in her business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy shelves and goods such as clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Clova

texts.en:
Since arriving in the United States from Jamaica in 1991, Clova worked in the real estate industry, but in 2009, she was inspired to make a mark for herself and become independent.

Clova initially started CT&T Consulting because she recognized it as a convenient option that she could excel at, but it has since evolved into her passion to help the clients who turn to her for support. She provides various services to her clients including preparing legal documents and preparing taxes from January to March.

CT&T Consulting is currently a one-woman business and Clova would like to use this loan to add members to her team and improve her marketing efforts.

Help this single mother meet her loan goal, hire new employees, and execute more effective and aggressive marketing tactics.

loans.use: To hire additional employees

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis moved from Ecuador to the United States without his parents when he was just five years old. In 2011, when his father took ill, Luis started Amazonic Products as a way to make ends meet and pay for his father’s medical care. Unfortunately, his father passed away shortly after and Luis has determined to make Amazonic Products a success so that he will never have to worry about not being able to provide a loved one with the proper medical care.

Through Amazonic Products, Luis sells Amazonic Tan, a suntan lotion that features an exclusive blend of natural ingredients and nutrient-dense oils that have been selected for their nutritional properties. These natural ingredients are not only safe but also have the most potent healing and renewing properties for healthy and youthful skin. 

Luis has had a lot of success selling Amazonic Tan.  A store in Hollywood, California purchased his product and it sold out there in just two weeks. He currently has another retailer interested in carrying his product. 

Luis will use this loan to add another product to his inventory: Amazonic Tan Sunscreen with SPF 50. 

Help this entrepreneurial father of four expand his inventory.

Check out his business here: http://Amazonictan.com

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for his business.

loans.name: Oscar Dorian

texts.en:
Becoming a lawyer has always been Oscar's dream. Oscar is currently attending the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho, working towards his degree in law. He plans on graduating in December, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Oscar plans on spending the money towards purchasing his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them Oscar hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. 

With a career in law, he expects to earn $30 a day. Oscar's parents were never able to complete their primary education and for his family finances have always been tight. With two older siblings Oscar is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Me llamo María Guadalupe tengo 42 años soy casada tengo 4 hijos me dedico al comercio desde hace 10 años, mi papa se dedicaba a la costura maquilaba la jerga, franela, y después hace 10 años decidí independizarme con mi esposo y tenemos un taller en mi casa donde maquilamos la jerga, franela, trapo, mechudos
Estoy solicitando el crédito para comprar materia prima para mi fabricación de mi producto. En el negocio 
Fabricamos el mechudo, jergas, franelas trapos de cocina y los vendemos por mayoreo y un poco de menudeo
Mis mayores logros son darle una educación de mis hijos, lograr estabilidad económica y tener mi casa.
texts.en:
"My name is María Guadalupe and I am 42 years old.  I am married and have four children.  I have had my own business for ten years.  My father worked as a sewer.  He made sack cloths and flannels .  Ten years ago I decided to move in with my husband and we have a workshop in our house where we make sack cloths, flannels, and mops.

"I am applying for this loan to buy basic materials for making my products.

"We make sack cloths, flannels and kitchen mops and sell them in bulk or individually.

"My biggest goals are to provide my children with an education, to be financially stable, and to have my own house."

loans.use: Compra de hilos y otras materias primas para fabricar jergas, franelas y trapos.

loans.name: Shirley Jhovana

texts.en:
Becoming a systems engineer has always been Shirley's dream. To achieve her goal, Shirley has enrolled in the Universidad Mayor de San Simon. She plans on graduating in June, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

With a loan, Shirley plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Shirley feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. One of Shirley's biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in systems engineering, she expects to earn $22 a day. Because Shirley's parents were never able to complete their primary education, their family's finances have always been tight. With an older sibling in college as well, Shirley hopes to be able help support her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, or “Chef D” as he is affectionately called, is truly a “jack of all trades.” A thriving entrepreneur, skilled chef, and champion for his community, Chef D embodies the idea of success, in all aspects of his life. 


Chef D’s extensive experience in the food industry, ranging from roles in management to product development, began with a little restaurant called the Heritage Internet Café that he co-owned with his father back in 2006. Later, Chef D managed a national restaurant chain, and was promoted to product development, leading the execution of three of the corporation’s popular menu concepts.


In January 2011, after years of working in the corporate world and learning the ins and outs of the industry, Chef D decided he wanted to return to running his own business. In May of that year, Chef D opened “It’s a Wrap Café”, an innovative establishment offering healthy and affordable fare in his hometown of Plainfield, New Jersey.


Now, Chef D’s catering business spans the New York, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey states. The first volume of his autobiography, aptly titled “Jack of All Trades: Mastered by One,” hits stores soon—as does an episode on Food Network featuring his restaurant and it’s noble work in the community during the devastation of Hurricane Sandy last year.


As many who meet him will attest, Chef D is passionate about what he does, and what he does is provide value for his customers. He cares about people, and that is what sets It’s a Wrap and his other ventures apart from the competition.


A graduate of Johnson and Wales University, Chef D is passionate and dynamic—the perfect personality for a business owner. He credits his childhood, when he would frequent banquet halls, as his inspiration for pursuing this career path. And that path involves big dreams.


Looking forward, Chef D’s goals involve expanding the catering and retail side of the restaurant, and opening new storefront locations. A repeat borrower in good standing with the Intersect Fund, Chef D needs working capital to help to complete rebranding efforts and allow further expansion of the business. The funds from this loan will go toward creating a new logo for the company and renovating the current storefront location.

loans.use: To rebrand and renovate this young entrepreneur's cafe and catering business.

loans.name: Sathi

texts.en:
Sathi is a rural married woman of 27 years, the mother of a daughter. She lives with her daughter and husband, 32 years old, in the small town Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. They have their own semi-pacca house (brick-built wall and straw roof).  She received education up to class X (Grade 10) in their village.  Her only daughter reads in class II (Grade 2).

Sathi's husband attended school up to class VIII (Grade 8). He is a car driver by profession. He is very sincere and hard-working.  Sathi is also trying hard to give financial support to help her family.  She wants to provide sustenance for her family.  She has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She wants to buy a cow to start a milk supply business.  She wants to sell milk from door to door in her locality.  She hopes this business will be a profitable one as there is a great demand for milk in the present market. Her main interest is to continue fighting for the betterment of her family and give her daughter a better education.

She hopes to upgrade their house to a pacca one (concrete made).

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a business of selling milk.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 24-year-old married woman and mother of three children. For the past 10 years, she has been in the business of clothes. She provides a valuable service in her community by selling the clothing that she purchases from the central bazaar to many of her neighbors. Her three daughters are also involved in the business.

Shazia is in her second loan cycle, and has a strong association with BRAC. She has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more clothes to increase the production capacity of her clothing business. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.en:
Marisela was accepted into the Universidad Amazonia De Pando, and now with the chance to work in business administration, is concerned about affording her school costs. She plans on graduating in November 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Marisela plans on using the loan to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Pando. 

Marisela currently works 30 hours a week as a secretary, but making time to work and go to school has been one of her biggest challenges. With a career in business administration, she expects to earn $25 a day. 

With one younger brother, Marisela hopes to be a role model by being the first in her family to graduate from university. Marisela's father's salary from his job as a gardener is the family's primary source of income. Marisela hopes to be able to contribute towards her family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is 40 years old. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband, Haripada, received only primary education, up to class IV (grade 4). They have only one son. They live in the small village of Anandanagar in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own small kaccha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).

Minati's husband is a blacksmith by profession. He purchases iron from the market and makes different kinds of household tools (hammers, saws, sickles, knives, etc.) and sells them in the local market. 

In the area where they live, most people are cultivators, so his products have a good market. But the prices of iron are increasing day by day, and it has become very difficult to continue the business due to lack of capital. Minati and her son also help him in his work. Yet, the income from the business is not sufficient to give the family a decent lifestyle.

Minati learned about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and applied for a loan to help her husband to buy iron from the market to continue his business.

With this loan, she hopes to improve the business, their standard of living and upgrade their shop to a pacca (concrete) one.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the blacksmith business.

loans.name: Jean Karlo

texts.es: Jean, tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltero, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida, junto a su hermano y su madre. Jean inicio ayudando a su madre con la venta de tamales. Hace 3 años que estableció su propio negocio de venta de verduras, frutas, granos básicos, refrescos y agua en bolsa. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 8,000 lempiras y  lo invertirá, en la compra de frutas como uvas, manzanas, peras  y verduras para vender y aprovechar la temporada. Su plan es agrandar el negocio y poder establecer una pulpería y obtener ganancias para seguir estudiando en la universidad y ayudar a su madre.
texts.en:
Jean is 21 years old and single. He lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida, with his brother and mother. 

Jean began by helping his mother sell tamales. Three years ago he established his own business selling vegetables, fruit, basic grains, soft drinks and water. 

He is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras in order to invest in the purchase of fruit such as grapes, apples, pears and vegetables to sell to take advantage of the season. His plan is to grow the business and to establish a grocery store to obtain earnings in order to continue studying at university and to help his mother.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as grapes, apples and pears for the season and to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 48 años de edad, es una persona acompañada que estudio hasta noveno grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos quienes asisten a la escuela y dependen de las actividades que realiza. 

Luis  se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcelas camina 1.5 Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que posee.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes que necesita para poder arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional, por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia.

 Luis, planea  en un futuro poder construir una vivienda digna para su familia; ya que actualmente vive en una de adobe.
texts.en:
Luis is 48 years old, has a life companion, and studied until the ninth grade. He gets up at 5:00AM with his wife and children who attend school and depend on the work he does.
