loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, charcoal, tea leaves and beans.

loans.name: G.s Las Arenas Group

texts.es:
La  señora  Ritza   es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos  en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta  de  sandias.
Doña Ritza su negocio lo realiza en diversas  zonas de Choluteca donde su  producto es muy  exigido. Con el préstamo ella espera tener más  producto para poder cubrir todos los pedidos que realizan sus clientes ya que  por ahora no  tiene  el  producto necesario.
Doña Ritza espera el aumento de sus ventas y que su negocio siga creciendo y le brinde las  ganancias necesarias para  optar a tener una mejor calidad de vida y así enviar  a sus hijos a estudiar.
Doña Maria Ana se dedica a la compra y venta de sandias desde 12 años.
Doña Wendy Araceli se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 6 años. 

Choluteca, Honduras  –  Diciembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Ritza  is a honest, responsible and hardworking person who lives in the south of Honduras with her children. Her business is selling watermelon. Ritza does business in various neighborhoods of Choluteca where her product is much sought after. With the loan she hopes to buy enough product to cover all the requests she has from clients. Right now she doesn't have enough produce. Ritza hopes to increase her sales and continue to expand her business. This would provide her with all the revenue needed to opt for a higher quality of living and also send her children to study. 

Maria Ana has bought and sold watermelon for 12 years. Wendy Araceli has sold meals for 6 years. 

Choluteca, Honduras  –  December 2013.

loans.use: to buy watermelon for her business.

loans.name: Eubelen

texts.en:
Eubelen is married with one child.   She helpls her husband working on their own farm.  She has been doing this for more than ten years, earning a good living for the family.  She grows and harvests fruits, specializing in papaya, and sells them in the market.   

She joined GDMPC and asked for a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm. Eubelen is hoping to earn more profit to improve the quality of life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Noralyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling Natasha products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Noralyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of Natasha products to sell.

Noralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can buy farm land.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Celna

texts.en:
Celna is 51 years old and married with five children.

Celna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Celna requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Celna has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Domecita

texts.en:
Domecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Domecita earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business. 

Domecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of  loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling wood in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional wood to sell for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns additional income from farming rice.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As the married mother of two children, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Elma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.en:
Cleotilde is 49 years old and married with five children.

Cleotilde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles and spices.

Cleotilde has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cleotilde aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles and spices

loans.name: Tulia Group

texts.en:
Chison is in his early 40s, married with one son who is still in school. He has been selling spare parts since 2007.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Chison's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep increasing his stock of spare parts.  He is doing great, and he is very happy with a loan.  He has managed to pay all of his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, cover household expenses and buy small items which were missing from his stock but were in demand.  He will use this loan to buy the latest types of spares. He dreams of buying a lorry for carrying his spare parts.

Chison will share this loan with his loan group "Tulia" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the latest types of spare parts needed for his business.

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Lucas is a married man with two boys; one of them is in school. Lucas, who is in his early 40s, has been running a business of manufacturing furniture, where he makes chairs, sofa sets, etc. He has been in this business for eight years now. He works from 7 am to 6 pm each day, and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he paid in full, he bought business raw materials: mattresses, woods, and nails. He used his business profit to pay school fees, household expenses, and saved for his children.

He will use this loan to buy wood and mattresses to make furniture to sell.  

Lucas is thankfull for our business product, and he dreams of owning a big business. 

He will share this loan with his loan  group, "URAFIKI", which has two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy wood and mattresses for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Srey Sonthor district where farming is a common way to earn a living, Sokchea is 54 years old and married. As a mother, she has struggled to grow cabbage for about 24 years. The current business earns her about US $11 per day to support her family. 
 
Sokchea is a second cycle client with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her better support her current business. 

Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Santhor District

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда порядочная и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1962 году на севере Таджикистана. Хуршеда вдова и имеет 2 совершеннолетних детей. Хуршеда сама вырастила своих детей с большим трудом, так как ее муж умер давно. Хуршеда более 30 лет работает в государственной организации. Она имеет высшее образование. Ее коллеги уважают и знают ее как трудолюбивую и интеллигентную женщину. Она недавно купила новый дом, но она не имеет денег для легализации документов дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для оформления документов своего дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Khursheda is a decent and determined woman. She was born in 1962 in northern Tajikistan. Khursheda is a widow and has two adult children. She raised her children herself with much difficulty because her husband died long ago. 

Khursheda has worked for a government organization for more than 30 years, and has a higher education.  Her colleagues respect her and know her to be a hardworking and intelligent woman. Not long ago she bought a new house, but does not have the money for the legal documents. She is requesting a loan of 3,000TJS to be able to submit the paperwork for her house. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: For legalization the documents of her new house

loans.name: Jeidi Noe

texts.es:
El señor Jeidi Noé es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de medicinas, desde hace 4 años.
Don Jeidi Noé esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de medicinas como panadol, acetaminofen, jarebes para la tos, etc.  y así poder seguir realizando esta actividad.
Don Jeidi Noé con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Don Jeidi Noé espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre del  2013
texts.en:
Jeidi Noé is a hardworking and responsible person who lives in the south of Honduras with his family. His business is selling medicine. He has done this for 4 years selling door-to-door in the municipality where he resides. He needs a loan to buy medicine like panadol, acetaminophen, cough syrup, etc. so he can continue with his business activity. Jeidi Noé hopes that with the loan he can increase his sales and thus increase his revenues. Thanks to this he can improve the quality of life of his family with more money coming in. Jeidi Noé wants in the short term to expand his business and with this continue to support his family and provide his children with the necessary studies so they have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – December 2013.

loans.use: to buy panadol and acetaminophen, cough syrup etc. for his business.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: At the age of 19, Sherly got married. She is now 38 years old and has four children. She and her husband work diligently to sustain their family's daily needs. Sherly's husband works as a laborer in an agricultural company, and she is engaged in selling grocery items in their village. She wants to expand her business but due to financial constraints, she can’t pursue it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and food seasonings to sell. Sherly hopes that her business will grow progressively so she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Ma Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes es una señora muy capaz y muy trabajadora, acompañada la cual en compañía de su pareja y sus 6 hijos quienes viven bajo su techo trabaja en la agricultura siembra y cultivo de café. Ella tiene un grado de estudio primario incompleto cursado hasta el 2 grado que por la falta de apoyo económico por sus padres no pudo completar su primera fase estudiantil. Tiene más de once años de dedicarse a esta actividad en compañía de su pareja ya que fue el quien le enseñara a trabajar ya que el terreno donde están ubicados sus cultivos de café está en la misma propiedad donde está construida su casa de habitación por lo que esto permitió que ella se interesara más al ver a su pareja desarrollar el proceso para al final de cada temporada vender el grano de café. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, familiares, amigos e intermediarios que viven y llegan a la zona para adquirir el producto el cual es considerado de muy buena calidad. Como desafío presentado como pequeña agricultora es el alza de precios en cuanto a los insumos que son utilizados para asistir sus cultivos más el acarreo del mismo desde el lugar de compra hasta su casa de habitación.
Por lo que hoy ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.
Sus metas poder llevar a cabo la construcción de una plancha de cemento para poder secar y lavar el grano una vez recolectado. Sus sueños formar una cooperativa de productores de café en la zona para poder llevar a cabo la gestión del grano de café en otros lugares del mundo y que conozcan la calidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a very capable and hard-working woman. She is in a common-law relationship and has 6 children. They live in their own house. She studied until Grade 2. Due to the lack of financial support from her parents she couldn't complete her primary school studies.

She works in agriculture growing coffee. For more than 11 years she has been involved in this activity along with her partner. He taught her to work the land. Their crops and house are on the same land, so she was interested to watch her husband carry out the process until the harvest of each year. Her clients are neighbors, family, friends and middlemen who live in the area or arrive to purchase a product that is considered to be of high quality. One challenge for the small farmer is the rise in prices of supplies that they use to assist their crops plus the costs to transport the supplies to her house.

At present she is requesting a loan to buy the agricultural supplies needs to assist and maintain her coffee crops. Her goals are to finish a cement structure to dry and clean the grains once harvested. She dreams of forming a coffee producers cooperative in the area to commercialize the coffee beans in other parts of the world so they can enjoy their quality.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a coffin-making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income raising pigs. Amalia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood and nails for her business.

Amalia has been managing her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood and nails for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Manos Trabajadoras De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Manos trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Eulalia quien se dedica  a la venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, inicia vendiendo plástico desde hace 15 años en Escuintla donde ella es originaria. También empieza su negocio vendiendo plástico como vendedora ambulante, hoy día ha logrado un pequeño local en su colonia y se siente muy contenta por los logros alcanzados durante 15 años en su vida como vendedora.  La fiesta de navidad se acerca y los clientes ya le empezaron a pedir chumpas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza, por tal motivo pide un crédito para aprovechar las ventas de estas fechas y no quedarles mal a sus clientes, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solcitado.
texts.en:
The person in charge of the "Dúo Manos trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa" group is Eulalia. She sells clothing for women, men and children. Fifteen years ago she started selling plastic in Escuintla, where she is from. Today she has managed to have a small store in her neighborhood and is very pleased to have passed 15 years of her life as a seller.

The Christmas season is coming and clients are staring to order jackets, pants, blouses, shirts and skirts. She doesn't have enough money so she is requesting a loan to take advantage of the sales of this time of year and not to disappoint her clients. She hopes that you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy new clothing for re-sale

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Dúo Luchando Por Nuestros Sueños Group

texts.es: Dúo Luchando por Nuestros Sueños La encargada de este grupo es la señora Edilma quien se dedica a la venta de ropa variada desde hace varios años, inicia como ambulante y ahora ya cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado de la ciudad capital.  Las fechas navideñas se aproximan y necesita invertir para surtir mas ropa en su negocio como blusas, pantalones, chumpas , suéteres y ropa interior para niños y caballeros, también dama.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por ello necesita un nuevo préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
Group Luchando por Nuestros Sueños [Fighting for our Dreams]:

The leader of this group is Edilma, who has been working selling varied clothing for many years. She started selling in the street and now has a place to sell clothes in the capital city market. The Christmas dates are approaching and she needs to invest to stock more clothing in her business like blouses, pants, jackets, sweaters, and underwear for children and men, women as well.

The money that she has is not enough, therefore she needs a new loan so she will not disappoint her customers. She is applying for this loan for the purchase of clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for selling.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara lives in the coastal region of Kenya.  She is a married woman with nine children, four of whom are in school and five of whom are adults.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has a store in her house in which she stocks and sells makuti (thatching materials made from palm leaves).  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more makuti for resale.  She expects to do this without any difficulties and to continue working without any problems

loans.use: to purchase more makuti (thatching materials made from palm leaves) for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has six children, all of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is aged 57 years and married, with nine children.  She is living in a rural village of the Ou dung district.  

The main sources of family’s income are from rice farming and selling mats in the village, which she and her husband have been in for 39 years to make a living. She can earn about USD 14 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Ny is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. 

Ny is going to pay her son’s university tuition, in the faculty of Management. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in the university.

loans.use: to pay her son’s university tuition

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de rosquilla, desde hace 10 años.
Doña María su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más maíz, harina, soda, manteca, azúcar, etc.  Para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña María con el préstamo espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña María espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en los diferentes problemas económicos que se les presenten, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre del  2013
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and responsible woman who lives in a community in southern Honduras alongside her family. She has ten years of experience in the business of selling donuts.  María runs her business out of her home. She needs the loan to purchase more corn, flour, baking soda, butter, sugar, and so forth. The extra ingredients will let her keep running her business, which provides a large part of her income.

With the loan, María hopes to increase her sales. The extra ingredients will help her considerably since she currently does not have all that she needs to cover her customers' daily demand. With increased sales and extra household income, she will be able to improve the quality of life of her family. María hopes to make her business grow in the short term and continue to support her family through the various economic issues that confront them so that they will have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: purchase flour, baking soda, butter and more for her donut shop.

loans.name: Markara

texts.en: Markara (in the photo), age 28, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has been married since 2012 and has three children: one attends school and the other two are still young. Markara is a mason, while his wife is a babysitter. He is asking for a loan to level up his house foundation. It would be better for his family members to live in.

loans.use: To level up his house foundation.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1990.  She has one brother. Her parents are farmers. In this picture, Lan is standing next to her mother.  Lan will be the first person in her family who has a bachelor's degree. She is now studying at Hai Phong Medicine University (http://hpmu.edu.vn/hpmu/). Lan hopes that after she graduates, she will not only be able to help her family, but also will have the knowledge to take care of her family and local community. 

Lan would like to borrow VND 7,900,000 to pay for her tuition fees as her course is one of the most expensive, and her parent’s income cannot provide funds for her studies.  Lan is really thankful for the help from the organization and hopes that more poor students like her will be able to participate this program.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Sophouek

texts.en:
Sophouek (pictured here), aged 32, is a garment worker. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has one young daughter. Her husband is a construction worker.

Sophouek does not have a motorbike for her family transportation. She needs to spend lot of money on traveling expenses. Hence she decided to apply for a loan in order to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her family use.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien was born in 1995. In this picture, she is standing next to her mother. She is studying Japanese at Foreign Trade University (http://www2.ftu.edu.vn/index.php/vi/). Her course will finish in 2017. She expects that after she graduates, she will be able to find a well paid job with a monthly income of VND 10,000,000.  Tien hopes that she will have the capabilities to help her parents, and also to provide better education for her sisters and brothers. 

Tien is requesting a loan of VND 15,300,000 to pay for her tuition fees, as both Tien’s father and mother are farmers, and they also have to support two other children who are school age. Their monthly income is not enough to provide funds for all of their children.  

She would like to express her appreciation for the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this program. This has been a lot of support for her education and for the Vietnamese youth in general.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is aged 45 and blessed with one child. She's in the food production business selling rice cakes, sweet bananas, and sweet delicacies. To have more capital, she would like to receive a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase rice, sugar, bananas, and flour for her business. She hopes to put up a stall in front of their house to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, bananas, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Patrocenio

texts.en: Atrocenio has operated a motorcycle transport business for more than ten years and earns a good income for his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to purchase tires and spare parts. Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to repair the vehicle that he uses in his business. He plans to buy an additional motorcycle for business expansion and to help his family with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires and spare parts for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Paccha  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Paccha está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en el cantón de Nabon, lugar que goza de una extraordinaria vegetación, de un clima frió y de bellos paisajes. Su gente es amable, gentil y tradicionalista, aun guardan celosamente la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres le inculcaron, siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos la agricultura y la crianza de animales.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el grupo de crédito Paccha. 
La Señora Rosa tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo está en el colegio, sus tres hijos siguientes estudian en una escuelita de la localidad y su último hijo pasa en casa ya que es aún muy pequeño. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a las tareas del campo ya que esta actividad es una tradición en su familia, esto le ha permitido aportar a la economía de su hogar al mismo tiempo que pasa en casa y puede cuidar de su familia. Ella cultiva sus terrenos y cría animales. 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de animales, semillas y alimento, esta repitiendo 
el crédito para comprar cerdos, gallinas y alimento para animales para continuar creciendo en esta actividad y así mejorar la economía de su hogar. Su grupo de crédito le gusta porque en cada reunión platica con sus amigas de varios temas y cada vez se fomenta la unión entre ellas.
texts.en:
The loan team Paccha is made up of five female and one male member who all live in the canton of Nabon, a place blessed with extraordinary vegetation, a cold climate, and beautiful landscapes. The people are friendly, kind, and traditional, and they still jealously guard the culture and traditions that their parents taught them, farming and raising animals being the primary source of income in the region.

One of the group members is Rosa. This is her second loan with Paccha. Rosa is 33 years old and married, and she and her husband have six children. Their oldest boy is married and lives independently, their second son is in high school, and the three younger children study in a small village school. The youngest stays at home as he is still very little. Her husband works as a bricklayer and they own their own home.

Rosa works primarily in the field, a family tradition, and this lets her support the household economy while at the same time being at home and caring for the family. She works the land and raises animals. The money from her previous loan was invested in the purchase of animals, seeds, and feed. She is cycling the loan to buy pigs, chickens, and animal feeds so she can continue to grow in this line of work and improve her household's income. She likes her loan team because at each meeting, she is able to chat with her friends about various things and build the bond among them.

loans.use: buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Maria Luz works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). Maria Luz is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Maria Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Greyler

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Greyler works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from bamboo splitting. Greyler is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Greyler has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Arnie

texts.en:
Arnie is 25 years old and single. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Arnie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arnie has been farming corn for two years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. She is working tirelessly towards reaching her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Katy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 34 membres fait parti du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 21 décembre 2009. Il est composé des femmes qui habitent la même localité et ses environs. Les membres entretiennent une parfaite entente entre elles et sont solidaires. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Satou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 filles. Elle s'investit dans la transformation de produits locaux. Elle achète des produits locaux dans les marchés hebdomadaires qu'elle transforme en jus pour ensuite les revendre. Elle achète 04 Bassines de bissap à 1500 F la bassine, 10 Kg de tamarin à 400 F le Kg, 10 Kg de gingembre à 800 F le Kg, 25 Kg de ditakh (fruits sauvages) à 500 F le Kg. Elle achète aussi 01 sac de sucre à 27 250 F. Après transformation, elle obtient 25 litres de jus de bissap qu'elle revend à 1500 F le litre, 24 litres de jus de tamarin, 24 litres de jus de gingembre et 24 litres de jus de ditakh qu'elle revend à 2000 F le litre de chaque.
Avec les bénéfices, elle achète du matériel pour la préparation du jus (équipements). Elle aspire créer des emplois dans l'avenir et avoir une autonomie financière pour appuyer ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group of 34 members constitutes a portion of the village bank created on the 21st December 2009. It is composed of women who live in the same area. The members get on very well together, and support each other. Their main activity is commerce. Satou, who is standing up on the right of the picture, with her hand raised, is 43 years old. She is married and a mother of 2 girls. She works in transforming local products, buying them in the weekly markets and making them into juices for re-sale. She buys 4 bowls of hibiscus at 1500 F a bowl, 10kg of tamarind at 400 F a kg, 10kg of ginger at 800 a kg, and 25 kg of ditakh (wild fruits) at 500 F a kg. She also buys 1 bag of sugar at 27 250 F. After processing, she has 25 litres of hibiscus which she sells at 1500 F a litre, 24 litres of tamarind juice, 24 litres of ginger juice and 24 litres of ditakh juice, all of which she sells at 2000 F a litre. 
With the profits she generates she can buy equipment to process these juices. She aims to create jobs in future, and to have financial independence so she can pay  her children's school fees.

loans.use: to transform local products

loans.name: Uraia Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early forties, is married with two children.  One has finished school and the other one is still in school.  She has been running several businesses, selling water, juice and has had a beauty salon for ten years now. 

This will be Asha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use for buying salon equipment, juice and water. She dreams of opening another shop with the same items.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group Uraia, which has a total of thirteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipments, juice and water.

loans.name: Ngorongoro Group

texts.en:
Maria, who is is her early 40s, is married with five children. Three of her children are in school while two are grown. For three years now, Maria has been managing her family by running a business selling dagga (small dry fish). She sells them from 7am to 2pm per working day and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Maria's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, Maria bought stock of dagaa to meet her business plan. She used the profit she earned to cover school fees, home and medical expenses. Maria will use this loan to buy dagaa for selling. She dreams of being a seller of dagaa up-countries. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Ngorongoro," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy dagga (small dry fish) for selling.

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.en:
Dora is in her mid 30s and is single with three children. Two of her children are still at school and one has finished schooling.  

Dora has been running two types of businesses; a food vending business and a charcoal selling business.  She has had her business for two years now.  She works from 11 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Dora's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy food stock, more chairs and tables for more customers and to start selling charcoal.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and meet customer's demand.  She is hard working and dreams of being successful in her business.  

Dora will share this loan with her loan group Uhuru which has a total of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of  charcoal and meet customer's demand.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es: El señor Apolinar es una persona trabajadora y responsable, es viudo y tiene dos hijos pequeños que dependen de sus ingresos, su principal actividad es la agricultura y la lechería, con varios años de experiencia en el rubro. La producción agrícola es destinada para el auto consumo, la chala de maíz se aprovecha como forraje para la alimentación del ganado bovino, de los cuales también se  aprovecha el estiércol como guano para la producción, y la producción de lechería es vendida a los productores de quesillo de la zona. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de acciones de la Empresa PIL. S.A. para entregarles toda su producción y así podrá tener un mercado seguro e incrementará sus ingresos.
texts.en: Apolinar is a hard-working and responsible person. He is a widower and has two small children who are dependent on him. His main activity is agriculture and dairy. He has a number of years in this field. The agriculture is for their own use. The corn husk is used as food for his cows. He also uses manure like guano for his production. The dairy produce is sold to the cheese producers in the region. The loan he is now requesting is to buy shares of  Empresa PIL. S.A. in order to give them all his production and have a secure market and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy shares of the company Empresa PIL. S.A to give them his production.

loans.name: Chanleaph

texts.en:
Chanleaph (pictured here), age 41, lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2001 and has six children. One is a garment worker and the others are in school and younger. 

Chanleaph and her husband are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in their village.

Chanleaph wants to fill in the land behind her house because there are tiny ponds. She does not have a proper bathroom for her family to use. Hence she decided to apply for a loan fill in the land behind her house and build a bathroom for her family.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house and build a bathroom for her family.

loans.name: Rabeya

texts.en:
Rabeya is 49 years old and married. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two daughters. Both Rabeya and her husband, Mofizul, are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their two daughters are receiving education. They read in class IX (Grade 9) and class VIII (Grade 8). They live in the village of Tholai, in Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Mohijul is engaged in agribusiness. Though he is 51 years old, he is very energetic and hardworking. He grows vegetables on his inherited piece of land. He sells his harvest in the local market and earns money for a livelihood, but his income is too low to run a family of four members well. So Rabeya has decided to start a new business selling milk and dairy products.

As soon as she heard about Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS), Rabeya applied for a loan to help her husband financially to buy a dairy cow. Her plan is to start a milk supply and dairy products (butter, curd, paneer, etc.) business. She wants to supply milk and dairy products from door to door in her locality and in the local market. These products are in great demand in the present market.

Rabeya would like to keep working hard to make every one of her dreams a reality, such as to upgrade their poor financial condition, build a pacca house (concrete-made), and give a successful future to their children. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina de 56 años de edad, es una mujer que busca superarse cada día; estudio hasta cuarto grado , pero logro hace seis años estudiar a distancia 5° y 6° grado.  Ella dice que nunca es tarde para preparase  y que si se le presenta la oportunidad seguirá  formándose en los estudios. Está casada y gracias a su esposo que la apoya, es que ella tiene esta iniciativa de formarse. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería. Sus 4  hijos ya son adultos y han formado su propio hogar.

Desde muy pequeña aprendió el oficio de la pacificación,  cuenta que fue su madre quien le enseño este actividad y con ella elaboraba pan en su  juventud, pero desde hace seis años decidió poner su propio negocio (panadería), la cual le está dando buenos resultados, ya tiene su clientela, cuenta con pedidos del cantón  y sus alrededores.
Además, de esta actividad productiva, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas para el comercio, buscando otras fuentes de ingreso.
Rosalina utilizara el préstamo,  para comprar  insumos (harina, azúcar, canela, entre otros), ya que para esta época tiene varios pedidos, que con su capacidad de producción no los cubriría y por el momento no cuenta con los recursos suficientes. Por ello solicita el préstamo, para aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta. De obtener mejores ganancias.

Su sueño,  es poder contar con horno industrial, que tenga mayor capacidad y poder capacitarse en la diversificación de pan y tener también la posibilidad de prepararse (seguir los estudios).
texts.en:
Rosalina is 56 years old. She is the kind of woman who looks for ways to improve herself every day. She only went to school through the 4th grade, but 6 years ago, she successfully studied through the 5th and 6th grades. She says it's never too late to get yourself ready, and if the opportunity presented itself to her, she would continue with her studies. She is married, and thanks to her husband, who supports her, she is able to take this initiative to educate herself. Her husband works at farming and bricklaying. They have four grown children who have their own households now.

She learned how to bake bread from her mother when she was very little, and has been baking bread since her youth. Around six years ago, she decided to open her own bakery, and it turned out really well for her. She has her customer base, and takes orders from the neighborhood and surrounding areas. Apart from this, she also raises pigs and chickens for sale, as a means of finding other sources of income.

Rosalina will use this loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and cinnamon, since this is a time of year that has a variety of orders, and her current production capacity and resources cannot cover them all. She is asking for the loan to take advantage of the opportunity that's knocking and earn extra money for the season.

Her dream is to have an industrial oven with greater capacity and the ability to diversify her bread baking, and she would also love to have the chance of continuing her studies.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for her bakery to take advantage of the high season.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 30 years old, married and lives with her family in Ruessei Kaev District, a suburb of Phnom Penh. She is a homemaker who takes care of her family and manages the household, while her husband is the breadwinner of the family, working in the construction industry. His principal activity is working as a bricklayer, concreting and constructing houses and other types of buildings. Together they have three children who are still young and depend on their income.

Now Salim is requesting a loan to purchase construction supplies to make some home improvements. This will give them comfortable living conditions and improve their quality of life.

Big thanks to Kiva lenders who provide their funds to enable poor families to overcome the hardships in their lives.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Celina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Celina de 34 años de edad, siempre se ha dedicado al comercio,solamente pudo cursar sexto grado. Al no poder seguir estudiando, se vio obligada a dedicarse de lleno al trabajo. Esta casada y su esposo trabaja de vigilante  en una finca aledaña al cantón.

Todas las mañanas toma el bus, viajando cerca de 7 kilómetros, mientras ella se va para el trabajo, sus dos hijos están estudiando.  

ella se dedica a la venta de comida, alquila un local en la terminal de buses, tiene 7 años de realizar esta actividad. Anteriormente, tenia una pequeña pupuseria en su casa , pero al presentarsele la oportunidad de crecer , optó por tener productos mas variados y trasladarse a la ciudad.

Esta actividad la aprendió gracias a su madre, que fue quien le enseño el oficio. Trabaja de lunes a domingo  de 6:00 am a 3:00pm. En el negocio le ayudan su cuñada y una prima.


Celina necesita el crédito, para ampliar el local, comprar  un estante y mesas , ademas de diversificar mas los productos que ofrece a los clientes,  por el momento no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar estas mejoras y es por eso que se decidió a solicitar el préstamo. Teniendo este capital, podrá abastecer la demanda que se le presenta actualmente en su negocio. Cada vez hay mas clientes que solicitan sus servicios y productos, pero con la estructura y  menú actual no logran aprovechar esa oportunidad.

Su sueño, es tener su propio restaurante, involucrar a toda su familia y que pueda ser rentable, generando los recursos suficientes, para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y  cubrir sus necesidades fundamentales.
texts.en:
Celina is 34 years old. She has been involved in business her entire life, being able to stay in school only through the sixth grade. When she could no longer keep studying, she found herself obliged to engage fully in her work. She is married and her husband works hard on a farm bordering the town.

Every morning she takes the bus seven km across town. While she is at work, their two children go to school.  Her business is selling food. She rents a stand at a bus terminal and has seven years of experience in this work. Before, she sold pupusas (a typical Salvadoran meat pie) out of her house, but when she had the chance to grow, she chose to get a wider variety of products and move across town.

She learned this business from her mother. She works every day, Monday to Sunday, from 6:00 am until 3:00 pm. Her sister-in-law and a cousin help her run the business.

Celina needs this loan to expand her location, buy a shelf and some tables, and additionally broaden the goods that she offers her customers. At the moment, she doesn't have the resources to make these improvements, which is why she decided to request a loan. Once she has the capital, she will be able to stock for the demand that she currently has in her business. She is always getting more customers that request her goods and services, but with her current infrastructure and menu, she can't take advantage of the opportunity.

Her dream is to have her own restaurant which involves her entire family and is profitable, generating enough money that her children can stay in school and they can still cover their basic household needs.

loans.use: expand and diversify her restaurant to meet existing demand

loans.name: Yankhouba

texts.fr:
Âgé de cinquante ans, monsieur Yankhouba est un maçon qui a acquis une expérience de plus de 30 ans dans le métier. Il est marié à deux femmes et est père d’une grande famille. Son ainée, âgée de 22 ans, est une fille qui s’est d’ailleurs mariée, suivi d’un garçon, âgé de 20 ans qui l’appui dans le travail. Yankhouba ne s’active que le matin de 8h à 15h, et  l’après midi est réservé aux petits travaux de bricolages à la maison.
Il a besoin d’un crédit, pour acheter 2 mètres cube de bois de coffrage et augmenter son stock. Il pourra utiliser les uns et louer les autres.
Yankhouba s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et des autres charges de la maison. Son souci majeur est de mettre sa famille à l’abri du besoin.
texts.en: Mr Yankhouba is 50 years old and has worked as a builder for over 30 years. He is married to two women and has a large family. His eldest daughter is a married 22 year old, and the next oldest is his 20 year-old son who helps him in his work. Yankhouba only works between 8am and 3pm, and in the afternoon works on DIY at home. He is seeking a loan in order to buy 2 cubic metres of wood for making boxes, and in order to boost his stock levels. He aims to use some of these boxes and will rent out the rest. He will use the profits generated to look after his family's expenditures. His main concern is to make sure his family's needs are catered for.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make boxes, which he will use in his workshops or rent out

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one in school and one younger. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby from her home. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Scolasticah

texts.en:
Scolasticah is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.

Scolasticah would like to diversify her businesses. The previous loan enabled her to to save money in her poultry business. She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

Scolasticah is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Vingunguti 1 Group

texts.en:
Dickson, who is in his late forties, is married with five children, four of whom are in school while one is a little baby. For twenty-one years now, he has been involved with the business of buying and selling animals. He starts working from 6 am to 3 pm per working day and is able to win a very good monthly profit. 

This will be his seventeenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to purchase animals for his business and a motorbike. He is doing great in his job. Dickson used his profits to build a house and bought a sofa set, TV, DVD and a motorbike. He also used them to cover school fees and home expenses. Dickson will use this loan to buy cows and goats to resell for his business. He dreams that one day he will be able to build another house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group Vingunguti 1 which totals two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is aged 58, widowed, and a mother of four children. She started her business selling vegetables and snacks around her village. When she got tired of roaming her village (because she's not getting any younger), she decided to run a retail store business in her village. Gloria wanted to earn enough income because she wanted to help her grandchildren, even in a simple way. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase beverages, breads, biscuits, and food seasonings to sell. Gloria believes that by borrowing the loan, she can be able to improve her business and earns more profit.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, breads, biscuits, and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Dionesia is borrowing 8000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

Dionesia has been raising livestock for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is married with nine children and runs a general store. Her husband is a fisherman. 

She has been selling assorted grocery goods for more than five years, and she earns enough to provide for the family's needs. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) recently and borrowed a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. 

Analiza is hopeful that she will be able to improve her business in order to have a better source of income for the future of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 36 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soap, and shampoo.

Mely has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

Mely aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cristina has been in this business for three years.

She requested a 5000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. April has been in this business for two years now.

April requested a 16,000 Philippine pesos loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina de 34 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, se desempeña como empleada y también tiene su propio negocio. Esta acompañada y su pareja de vida,  trabaja en un taller mecánico ( enderezado y pintura), el esfuerzo de ambos genera el sustento de su familia. Sus tres hijos están estudiando.

Reina es empleada en  un negocio  que vende pollo frito, tiene 2 años de trabajar ahí, recibe le salario de $180 dolares mensual, dice que es mal remunerada pero que en la actualidad no puede darse el lujo de no trabajar, esta difícil la situación, del empleo en el país,. Por eso, para obtener otra fuente de ingresos se dedica  al corte y confección de trajes,  los vecinos necesitan de su servicios y ella aprovecha la oportunidad  para poner en practica lo que pudo aprender de costura, gracias a su madre. Trabaja como empleada de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana realiza los trabajos de costura que se le presentan.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una maquina de costura nueva y materia prima para costurar,  la maquina que tiene esta desfasada y presenta desperfectos, lo cual le dificulta su trabajo, como solo los fines de semana tiene para trabajar en su negocio, necesita mejores condiciones para cubrir con los trabajos que se presentan, así tendrá mejores ingresos para su familia.


Su sueño, es tener su propio taller de costura que le permita cubrir con las necesidades básicas de su familia y también poder generar empleo para otras personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Reina is 34 years old and very hard-working. She is both an employee and the owner of her own business. Her partner works as a mechanic at a bodywork and painting shop, and together their work manages to sustain the family. They have three children in school.

Reina is an employee at a business that sells fried chicken. She's been there two years and receives a salary of $180 per month. She says the work pays poorly, but she doesn't currently have the luxury of not working. Employment in the country is a difficult situation. So as another source of income, she also makes and sews clothing. Her neighbors need the service, and she takes advantage of the opportunity by using the sewing lessons she learned from her mother. She works as an employee from Monday to Friday, and on weekends she does the sewing jobs she's gotten.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy a new sewing machine and some new material for sewing. The machine she has is old-fashioned and causes errors. This makes her job even harder as she only has the weekends to work at her business. She needs better working conditions to cover the jobs she gets and earn the income she needs for her family.

Her dream is to own her own sewing shop that would let her meet the basic needs of her family and would also create employment for other people that need it.

loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline thanks you for her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

Now, she would like to borrow 15,000 KES to buy more stock of cooking oil, eggs, maize flour, rice, tea leaves and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, eggs, maize flour, rice, tea leaves and sugar

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with one child, who is still underage.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki lives at the Coastal region of Kenya.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sweets, bananas, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking  oil and oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, bananas, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil and oranges

loans.name: Malezi Mema Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline, who is in her early 20s, is single with two children, a boy and a girl. One of her kids is in school while another is still a baby. For three years now, she has been managing her family expenses by running a clothes business selling fabrics. She works from 7am to 6pm each day and is able to make a good profit. 

This is Jacqueline's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy a plot of land for house building.  She used her previous loan, which she has paid back in full, to buy stock of fabrics for her business. Jacqueline is working hard to see that her babies get a better life. She used her profit to cover home and school expenses, and saved a small portion in the bank. She dreams to provide better education to her babies.

Jacqueline will share this loan with her loan group "Malezi Mema," which totals 4 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for house building.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 67-year-old widowed woman. She has nine children with ages ranging from 17 years to 50 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add a stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add a stock of charcoal

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is 47 years old, married and a mother of six children living in a rural village of the Stoung district of Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income and her husband supplements the income by working as a teacher and sometime also working for others. 

Sim has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Now, she is asking for an education loan to pay for her daughter’s university. She has high hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university and thus also allow her daughter to obtain a higher education and good job in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children who are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of  40,000 KES to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Pucacruz  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Pucacruz está formado por 14 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una belleza natural ya que se encuentra en lo más alto de una montaña y desde allí se observa los paisajes, su gente se dedica a las tareas del campo como la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos salen a diario a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. Las socias aún conservan con orgullo su vestimenta tradicional al igual que su gastronomía, siempre luchan para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está en la escuela del sector, su esposo labora en la construcción, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Rosa pasa en casa al cuidado al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de ganado, gallinas y cuyes, también a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta.
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar pollos y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener más animales de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
The "Pucacruz" loan group consists of fourteen women who live in the surrounding area of the Valle parish in Cuenca, a place of natural beauty that sits in the highest parts of a mountain from where the landscape can be seen. Its people work in the fields in activities such as animal husbandry and agriculture; many people also head to the city every day for various types of work. The members still proudly preserve their traditional dress as well as their cuisine. They always strive to provide their children with a better future. 

One of the group members is Rosa. She is twenty-two years old, married, and has two children, aged two and five. Her first son attends an area school. Her husband works in construction. They live in their own home. 

Rosa spends her time at home caring for their children; however, to help her husband with living expenses, she raises chickens and guinea pigs as livestock. She also works in agriculture for both home and commercial use.

This loan is to buy chickens and animal feed. Her goal is to own more higher quality animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is married with three children. He has a transportation services business and he earns enough for their daily living. He joined GDMPC this year and has borrowed a new loan to purchase tires and spare parts. He wants to have another vehicle to use for his business. In the future, Nelson wants to have a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Judy works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from the direct selling of Natasha products. 

Judy is borrowing 14,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling young coconut juice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Yolanda earns additional income from food vending.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWFT to buy additional young coconuts, plastic cups, sugar, etc., for her business. She dreams of saving enough money so she can buy land in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional young coconuts, plastic cups, sugar, etc., for her juice business

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo is appreciative for her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more stock of cooking oil, charcoal, wheat flour, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, charcoal, wheat flour, and sugar

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 45 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Carmencita is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmencita has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking and enterprising man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He is married with six children all of whom attend school.

John sells goat meat to various butcheries and hotels. He has been in this business for the past two years. He sites seasonality as his major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES, John wants to purchase more goats for his business. He joined Yehu to boast his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for his business

loans.name: Salohiddin

texts.ru: Салохиддин жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 39 лет. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Живет Салохиддин в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход, для обеспечения своей семьи Салохиддин очень много работает. Он занимается посевом селхозкультуры, такой как лук и картошка. Этот вид бизнеса приносит Салохиддину хорошую прибыль. Но этот бизнес сезонный и если вовремя не удобрить земли, то урожай может не получиться. Сейчас Салохидину необходимо удобрить землю и поэтому он собирается купить минеральные удобрения. Но он не имеет достаточной суммы для закупа удобрения. Поэтому Салохиддин обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку минеральных удобрений. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Salohiddin is a cheerful, hardworking 39-year-old who is married and has 2 children.  He and his family live in a rural part of Tajikistan.  In order to have a continual source of income for his family, Salohiddin has to work very hard.  He sows crops such as onions & potatoes (among others) for a living.  This line of work pays well, but is seasonal, and can be quite finicky; for example, if the soil isn't fertilized in time, the harvest could be ruined.  

Currently, Salohiddin needs fertilizer himself.  He's specifically in need of mineral fertilizers, but lacks the money to buy them.  That being the case, he's turned to Arvand in hopes of a loan to buy these fertilizers, and would like to thank them in advance for their support.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old and has four children. Evangeline is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, specifically in pig fattening in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 7,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional piglet, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Evangeline has been in the pig fattening industry for two years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feeds, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Analeah

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Analeah works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from bamboo split. Analeah is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Analeah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling business with Avon products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional Avon products like lotion, body spray, underwear, etc. to sell to her customers.

Evangeline has been in this business for fiive years. Evangeline earns more income from buying and selling ready to wear.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon products like lotion, body spray, underwear, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, bread, etc for her general store business.

Angelita has been in this business for five years. Angelita earns more income from pig fattening.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could buy farm land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Elizeus, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children; one is in school. He also lives with his relatives. For three years and six months now, he has been engaged in business, selling freshwater fishes. He sells them at the street and other regions. He starts working from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. at the street per working day and is able to earn a small monthly profit. 

This will be his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his previous loan, which he repaid in full, he increased fish stock to meet his expanded market demand. Elizeus used his profit to buy a plot of land and reinvested back into the business. He also covered school fees and house expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of freshwater fishes to sell in other regions. He dreams to own a big business and transport.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Utulivu, which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of freshwater fishes to sell them in other regions.

loans.name: Twimanye Group

texts.en:
Hamidu, who is in his late 40s, is married with three children who are in school. For more than 20 years now, Hamidu has been a tailor, and also selling clothes. He starts working from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. per working day and is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he has repaid successfully, he paid business rent and purchased a tailoring machine and other business equipment. With the profit, he covered household expenses. Hamidu will use this loan to buy new fashion clothes to resell. He dreams to be a big tailoring man with a school of tailoring. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, Twimanya, which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new fashion clothes to resell.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 35 years old. She is married and has four children, aged 17, 11, 2 and 2. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Twigunane Group

texts.en:
Groria, who is in her early 30s, is married with three girls, two of whom are in school. For eight years now, she has been managing her family by running a business selling small dried fishes (dagaa). She starts working from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and is able to earn a fair monthly return. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy business dagaa for sale. Groria dreams to be able to afford getting her girls to a better school. She will share this loan with her loan group, Twigunane," which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy dagga (small dried fishes) for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena, es una madre trabajadora que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, tiene tres hijos quienes  estudian en la escuela secundaria, se ayuda con su esposo quien labora como guarda de seguridad y ella como operaria de una empresa privada, de esta manera ambos sufragan los  gastos del hogar y colegio para sus hijos. Poco a poco viene mejorando las condiciones de su casa, partes principales como los cuartos, este nuevo crédito que solicita es para construir otro cuarto que le permita asignar un cuarto independiente a cada uno de sus hijos para mayor privacidad, es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para comprar los materiales de construcción, que le facilite finalizar esta obra.
texts.en: Maria Elena is a hardworking mother who cares about the well-being of her family. She has three children who attend high school. She works as an operator for a private company to help her husband who works as a security guard. In this manner, they meet their living expenses and the cost of their children's tuition. Little by little, they are improving the conditions of their home in main areas such as rooms. This new loan that she is applying for is to build separate rooms for each of her children to give them greater privacy. That is why she is applying for this loan to buy construction materials which will help her to complete this task.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, and gravel.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, fierros, ladrillos,  arena, yeso, piedra chancada y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena y cemento.

Ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión de libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority”.
texts.en:
Segundina is grateful to the investors for her loan, and she feels satisfied because of the support offered. She continues with selling construction materials; for example, cement, iron, bricks, sand, plaster, crushed rock and other things. This time, she needs a loan to purchase construction materials like sand and cement.

She is 29 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has two children. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who moves her family forward with the effort of her work. She is a responsible person; for this reason, she was invited to participate in the communal bank "Señor de Coyllority".

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Razikul

texts.ru:
