Разикул 60 летний житель района А.Чоми. Всю жизнь он работал и трудился ради своей семьи. Он простой таджик, который трудится не покладая рук, чтобы прокормить семью. В своей жизни Разикул поведал многое. Ему 60 лет, но это не придел и он вставит перед собой новые цели и надеется достичь их. 
   Сейчас у Разикула новая цель он решил заняться скотоводством. Он знает все о домашних скотах и о деятельности скотоводства. Уже много лет у Разикула дома имеется корова для семейных нужд. Разикул надеется на свою удачу. Он хочет взять кредит и начать свой бизнес по купле и продажи крупнорогатых скотов. Таким решением он хочет иметь свой бизнес, который будет зависеть от него, обеспечить свою семью и себя на старости лет. С такими планами он обратился за кредитом, в надежде на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Razikul is 60 years old and a resident of the A. Jomi district of Tajikistan.  He has worked very hard his whole life.  He is a simple Tajik who works tirelessly to provide for his family.  He has gone through a lot during the course of his life. However, although he is already 60, he is still setting some new goals for himself, and he hopes to be able to achieve them. 

Razikul's new objective is to get involved in animal husbandry.  Having had a cow at home for domestic use for many years, he knows everything there is to know about livestock and raising cattle.  He hopes to find success in this new enterprise.  He is taking a loan to launch a new business and to start buying and selling cattle.  

Razikul's plan is to have his own business, so that he can independently provide for his family and for himself in his late years.  With this goal in mind, he has requested a loan and he is hoping to receive your help.

loans.use: to purchase a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives at the Coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Roda has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge: the high cost of purchasing fish especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Roda is requesting for a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood

loans.name: Masika

texts.en: This is Masika. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy more goats for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase five goats for her business. She appreciates Kiva  for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for her business

loans.name: Boromey

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sampov Meas district, Boromey is 22 years old. To make a living, he has been working in a local hotel and also farming rice for one year. He can earn about US $12 per day from his current business. 

Boromey is just with VisionFund this cycle. He is now applying for an education loan to pay for his university tuition fees to study finance and accounting. He hopes this loan will enable him to keep up with university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fees

loans.name: Vingunguti 2 Group

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with three kids. Two of his children are in school while one is small. For 15 years now, he has been engaged in the business of buying and selling animals. He works from 6 am to 3 pm and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is his seventeenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his business’ previous loans to buy animals that he has managed to sell. He is doing his level best to meet his business target. Daniel’s business profits have been used to buy DVDs, a TV, a sofa set, a mattress and to cover school fees and household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy cows, goats and sheep to resell. He dreams of buying a plot of land and building a house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group Vingunguti 2, which has 2 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep to resell.

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en:
Mwanamina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives at the Coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with two children, one in school and one who is too young for school.

Mwanaidi has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mejuma

texts.en:
Mejuma is a married mother of seven children, six schoolchildren and one adult.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

Mejuma has operated a grinding-machine business at the market for the past two years. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed woman with five children, four in school and one adult, which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

Luvuno has operated a cafe making edibles such as rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more stock for her business, such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks. She joined Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business, such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati is 53 years old. She is married and has 3 adult children, aged 36, 31, and 30. Many years ago, she established her grocery store.  She supports her family by working 7 days a week, 12 hours a day. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy goods for her grocery business. In the future, she plans to raise her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, such stores are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
Hera Devi is 54 years old. She is married and has 2 adult children, aged 30 and 28. Many years ago, she established her poultry business. She works 7 days a week, 4 hours a day, to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chicks for her business. In the future, she plans to raise her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once they are mature, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business

loans.name: Dhan Maya

texts.en:
Dhan Maya is 40 years old .  She is Married and has 2 children aged 20 and 15.  Many years ago, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Dhan Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en: Zuma thanks Kiva and Yehu for their loan funding policy that enabled him get extra income from his charcoal selling business. He also operates a motor cycle transportation business. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase spare parts for his motor cycle. He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Heat

texts.en:
Heat is 34 years old, married and has three children who live at home. For nearly 20 years, Heat has been engaged in farming rice and raising poultry to earn a living. With the help from her husband and children, Heat is able to earn a decent income, to pay for meals, school allowances for her children and other household costs.

Heat would like to buy more ducks to raise, but she has insufficient capital to make this possible. That’s why she is asking for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy 1,000 ducklings. Heat believes that she will be able to improve her income as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 ducklings to raise.

loans.name: Sarak

texts.en:
Sarak is 23 years old and single. He lives with his parents and other siblings in Kampong Chhnang province. Currently, Sarak works with the government as a journalist and also is a year-four student at Bright Home institute, majoring in General Management. With his little salary, Sarak saves some money for tuition fees at the beginning of the new academic year and uses some to pay for food; however, he still needs support from his parents every month. 

Due to insufficient money, Sarak needs a loan of USD 500 to cover the costs of his education fees. With the loan support, Sarak can afford to pay for his tuition fees and pursue a bachelor degree. He will try all his best at school and hopes that he will be a professional person, so he can find a well-paying job after graduation. Sarak expresses thanks to all lenders around the world, who have contributed their funds via the Kiva program to help poor students like him to further their education.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his education fees.

loans.name: Choeurng

texts.en:
Choeurng is a hard working woman who is engaged in agribusinesses in Kampong Cham province. She grows and harvests rice alongside her husband. Having been in this business for over 30 years, she is able to earn an income of KHR 8,000 per day. She is now 52 years of age and has six children: three married and three single.

To help her further develop her farming business, she is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. With this loan support and her hard work, she hopes to have a fruitful harvest for the coming season, and improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jetta

texts.en:
Jetta works hard to support her family. Jetta is single and has a farming banana business in the Philippines.

Jetta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jetta has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Jetta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old and is married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing PHP 10,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emily has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Summy

texts.en:
Summy is married with two children. He operates his own farm to make a living. He has been doing this for more than two years, and he was able to provide for the needs of the family. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs in order to improve the farm. He hopes to gain more returns from his effort and investments for a better living for his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nandarani

texts.en:
Nandarani is from the small village of Kathalbari in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a 37-year-old housewife. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She received an education up to class III (Grade 3). She lives with her children and her husband Basanta, 45 years old, in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw). Her husband received an education up to class III (Grade 3).  They are providing an education to both their son and daughter. They both read in class X (Grade 10).

Nandarani's husband has been involved in a retail clothing business.  He purchases new clothing stock from the wholesale market and resells it in their village. By doing this, he tries to cover the family's basic needs. But it has become impossible to maintain a decent lifestyle with his small income. So, they want to expand their business and to do so they need capital.

Nandarani heard about BJS and applied for a loan to help her husband by purchasing a new stock of clothing to expand the business. She is a very hardworking and enthusiastic woman. She wants to get involved in this business. She is hopeful that she will get a good market in their locality, which will enable her to get a good profit.

Her goals are to give good financial support to cover the family needs, give a better education to her children and enhance her business to secure their life.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: María Noemi

texts.es:
La Señora María  es socia del grupo de crédito Fe y Alegría desde hace 2 años, le gusta los créditos porque son rápidos. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que es Patrimonio Cultual de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos. Su gente es amable, gentil y cordial, aún conservan su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora María tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 18 (gemelos) de 13, 11 y 10 años, su primer hijo pasa en casa ayudándole en los quehaceres, dos están en el colegio y dos estudian en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada.
Doña María pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos los que vende en pie o pelados. 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y construir otro galpón para la crianza de estos animalitos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora María has been a member of the group of Fe y Alegría for 2 years. She likes the loans because they are fast.

She has lived in Cuenca, a city bathed by four rivers and a Cultural Heritage site, since December, 1999. The people are kind, gentle, and friendly, and they have retained their culture and traditions. Señora María is 38 years old, married and has 5 children ages 10, 11, 13, and has two twins who are 18. Her eldest child spends time at home helping with chores, two are in college, and two study in a local school. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have their own home so they live in a rented house.

Doña María spends time at home caring for her children, but to contribute to the household expenses, she raises chickens and sells them live or plucked. Her loan will be used to buy more chickens and to build another shed for raising these small animals. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and build a shed.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is 43 years of age, married and has two children. She currently lives with her husband and children in her own home located in Prey Veng province. To ensure there is enough food on the table and help her children in their education, Navy has been dedicated to farming and the pig raising business, which are the important sources of her family’s earnings. She has been doing this for over 10 years and earns approximately $4.16 per day.

Since she lives in the off-grid part of the province and can’t gain access to electricity, Navy decided to borrow a loan in the sum of USD 550 to buy a solar home system to place on top of her roof. Through this purchase, the entire household will be able to work at night time and can use other home devices such as TV and radio. She hopes the loan will be granted to enable her to give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to place on top of her roof.

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es:
María de 47 años de edad, es una madre soltera de un hija, ella logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, al no poder seguir estudiando, tuvo que  aprender un oficio que le permitiera sacar adelante  a su hija. Ademas, de ayudar a su mamá que vive con ella. 

Con muchas dificultades, pero con mucho esfuerzo a podido  llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Se siente afortunada de poder hacer lo que a ella le gusta, gracias a su empeño a podido perfeccionar su trabajo (sastrería), lo que le ha permitido defenderse  y tener ingresos para mejorar  sus condiciones de vida de su familia.

María se dedica el mayor tiempo a la sastrería, tiene 25 años de experiencia en esta actividad, además, en las tardes vende platillos típicos cerca de su casa, en esta actividad es apoyada por su hija, aprovechando que su casa se encuentra cerca de la carretera y hay varios clientes que llegan a degustar de sus platillos. El oficio de sastrería lo aprendió gracias a la enseñanza de su madre.

El préstamo lo necesita, para comprar material de construcción para su vivienda, esta la esta construyendo poco a poco, le falta mejorar el piso, instalar las ventanas y colocar le parte del techo. Con los ingresos que va obteniendo de sus actividades productivas, esta logrando su sueño, que es tener una vivienda digna.

Quiere aprovechar esta época( seca) para avanzar en la construcción, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital para hacer estas mejoras. Confía que con su esfuerzo podrá hacerle frente a la responsabilidad que adquirirá(préstamo)


Su principal sueño es terminar su vivienda y tener condiciones dignas, posteriormente se plantea tener un taller de costura donde pueda generar empleo a  familiares y vecinos.
texts.en:
María, who is forty-seven years old, is a single mother of one daughter. She managed to complete the ninth grade. Upon not being able to continue studying, she had to learn a trade that would allow her to provide for her daughter as well as her mother who lives with her. 

With much difficulty, but also with much effort, she has been able support her family. She feels fortunate to do what she enjoys. Thanks to her dedication, she has mastered her trade of tailoring, which has allowed her to look after herself and earn an income to improve her family's living conditions.

María puts most of her time into her tailoring. She has twenty-five years of experience in this activity. In addition to tailoring, she sells traditional foods around her home during the evenings. Her daughter helps her with this activity as they take advantage of their home being located next to a highway. There are several customers who come to sample her dishes. Thanks to her mother's teaching, she learned the art of tailoring.

She needs this loan to buy construction materials for her home, which she is gradually building. She still has to improve the flooring, install windows, and put up part of the roof.  With the income that she is earning from her profitable activities, she is achieving her dream: to have decent housing.  

She wants to take advantage of the dry season to make progress in the construction, but she doesn't have sufficient funds to make this improvements. She trusts that, by her effort, she will be able to meet her loan obligations. 

Her most important dream is to finish her home and have decent living conditions. Afterwards, she is considering having her own sewing workshop where she could create jobs for family members and neighbors.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her furniture making business.

Russel has been in this business for seven years. Russel earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Russel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Monuzkhan

texts.ru: Монузхан 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Сама Монузхан по характеру очень трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и просто заботливая мать. У Монузхан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Монузхан занимается животноводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Монузхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также в активах имеет 0,35 ГА земельной доли, на которой выращивает картофель и морковь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Монузхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Монузхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Monuzkhan is 34, married, and raising a son together with her husband, who helps her tend the family farm.  Character-wise, Monuzkhan is very hardworking and goal-oriented, and a caring mother to her son.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, first starting 2 years ago with 50,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, Monuzkhan currently has 3 dairy cows and a 0.35 hectare plot of land for growing potatoes and carrots, and her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Monuzkhan is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy some cows, fatten them, and sell them for a profit at a local market.  She plans on using any extra money that the loan will allow her to make to continue to buy more livestock for her farm.

loans.use: buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Crupskaya Ibeth

texts.en: Crupskaya is interested in systems engineering. Crupskaya is currently attending the Universidad Domingo Savio, working towards her degree. She plans to graduate in January 2015 but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With this loan, Crupskaya plans to buy her schoolbooks. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Crupskaya currently has a job in technical support. She works 30 hours a week and earns $7 a day. With a degree in systems engineering, she expects to earn $15 a day. Because Crupskaya's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education, her parents never had the chance to increase their earning potential. Growing up, the family's finances were always tight. With one younger sister, Crupskaya hopes to be a role model by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for three years now.

Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Rakhimajan

texts.ru: Рахимажан 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Дети работают на рынке. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Живут одной большой дружной семьей. Каждый член семьи пытается внести свой вклад в развитие благоустройства своей семьи. Сама Рахимажан по характеру очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мать. У Рахимажан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рахимажан занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рахимажан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахимажан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Рахимажан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Рахимажан 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Дети работают на рынке. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Живут одной большой дружной семьей. Каждый член семьи пытается внести свой вклад в развитие благоустройства своей семьи. Сама Рахимажан по характеру очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мать. У Рахимажан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рахимажан занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рахимажан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахимажан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Рахимажан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома.

Rakhimajan is 44, married, and raising 4 kids together with her husband.  Her kids work at a local market, while her husband helps her tend the family farm.  They all live together as one big, happy family.  Everyone contributes as they can toward the family's well-being.  Character-wise, Rakhimajan is very hardworking and a caring mother to her children. She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, first starting 14 years ago with 6,000 som worth of animals. Thanks to her persistent efforts, Rakhimajan currently has a calf on her farm, and her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som. To further develop her farm, Rakhimajan is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy some cows, fatten them, and sell them for a profit at a local market. She plans on using any extra money that the loan will allow her to make to continue to buy more livestock for her farm, as well as to make some home repairs.

loans.use: buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Dúo Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: La encargada de este grupo es la señora Francisca Guadalupe quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace varios años,  las fiestas navideñas se acercan y ya necesita comprar más güipiles, cortes, blusas, fajas, delantales y algunos suéteres porque sus clientes ya le empezaron a encargar para esa fecha.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un capital más para que pueda comprar la ropa que le falta, ella ya ha trabajado otros creditos anteriores y no ha caido en mora y espera que nuevamente le piden ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Francisca Guadalupe is in charge of this group.  She has been selling traditional clothing for several years.  The Christmas holidays are coming and she needs to buy more traditional tunics, skirts, blouses, woven belts, aprons, and some sweaters because her customers have started requesting them for the holidays.  The money she has now isn't enough, and she finds herself in need of another loan so she can buy the clothing she needs.  She has had other loans previously and has never defaulted.  She hopes to be helped out again with the loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Meet Cleophas, a farmer living in Nyamira, which is an area popularly known for the growth of bananas. He is married and has three children. He loves farming and has developed it as his source of livelihood. He has done it for 18 years, producing and selling milk, tea and bananas. Like most farmers in Nyamira, he enjoys growing tea and doing dairy farming, but he lacks the finances for carrying out his farming projects.

Cleophas chose Juhudi Kilimo because it helps small holder farmers to grow economically. He said that this loan will help him cater to his family's needs and also send his children to good schools, through the profit he gets out of the poultry business and his other farming activities. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for helping him out.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Meet Grace, a proud mother of six and a farmer living in Nyamira, a popular banana growing area in the Nyanza area of Kenya. She produces and sells tea, milk and vegetables. She has done farming for 20 years. This has been her basic source of income. She experiences a major challenge with cattle rearing.

Grace chose Juhudi Kilimo for this dairy loan because she has seen many farmers benefit from them and they also work closely with small holder farmers. During the training offered by Juhudi Kilimo, she learnt how to manage and repay loans.

Grace says that through the profits she will get out of the loan, her family will be well taken care of.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a 37-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, Anil, and four children in her kaccha house (made of straw and mud) in the village of Magurmari at Dhupguri. She and her 40-year-old husband are illiterate. They can only sign their name. Her children attend school in class ix (grade 9) and iii (grade 3). One of them does not go to school.

Kabita is a housewife and her husband is a van driver. Throughout the day, he drives a van but his income is too low to meet the family’s daily needs. Kabita is a hardworking lady. She grows potatoes on her own plot of land to support her husband financially. Together, they cannot cover their home expenses, educational expenses and the family’s basic necessities. Kabita has heard about BJS and she applied for a loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to expand her potato business. She will farm more potatoes and sell them in the village market, which will help her to acquire a large amount of profit. She will be able to make her family's living conditions better than before and give her children a better future. She is thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jahanara

texts.en:
Jahanara is a married woman who is 42 years old. She has three children who are studying in class VIII (grade 8), class V (grade 5) and class XII (grade 12). She lives in the village of Altagram at Dhupguri with her husband Rafiqul, 48 years old. Jahanara is illiterate and can only sign her name but her husband has passed standard V (grade 5).  She is a housewife and Rafiqul is a farmer.

Jahanara works hard from dawn to dusk for her family. Rafiqul farms their own plot of land to grow many kinds of vegetables to sell at the market. The earnings from their work are too low to cover the family's expenses. She decided to contribute to the family and to give financial support to her husband. As soon as she heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) offers loans to rural and needy women, she has decided to take a loan of 15,000 INR to buy more potato seeds for farming potatoes in huge amounts to earn more profit. She thinks her contribution should improve her family’s economic condition. In the future, her income will help her to change her kaccha house (made of straw and mud) into a pakka (concrete) house. Her children will get a proper and smooth education.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 56 years old and has six children. Claudia is married and has two children who are still in school.

Claudia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Claudia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

Claudia has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Claudia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Thealim

texts.en:
Thealim (in the photo) lives in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three children –one has full-time employment and the others attend school.

Thealim is a scarf weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. She wants to buy additional cotton materials for her scarf weaving business. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan.
 
Thealim buys cotton materials from the Phnom Penh market and sells her scarves to a middleman who comes to buy at her home.

loans.use: To buy additional cotton materials for weaving

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Reuka, age 26, is married to Ganesh who is 39 years old. They are literate but did not yet complete the school standard. Her husband is a farmer by profession and she is a housewife. They have two children who are both in class I (grade 1). She lives in Balirhat village at Dhupguri with her family.

She is staying in a semi-pakka house (walls made of brick and roofs made of straw). She works hard from morning to night. Ganesh looks after the farming but their earnings are not sufficient to cover their family’s daily needs. Her intention is to earn more money for her family and to help her husband financially. Now her family’s economic condition is so poor that she plans to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for farming potatoes in a large amount and selling them in the local market to increase their income. She will use this loan to buy more potato seeds and pesticides. 

Her future plan is to make her business smooth and to give her children a happy, peaceful life. In future,  she wants to make a pakka house (concrete house) for her family with the profit from her business so they will stay there for the rest of her life peacefully.

loans.use: To buy more potato seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Fini

texts.en:
This is Fini, 44, a resident of Chrang Chamreh commune, along the Nation Route 5, a suburb of Phnom Penh. He is married to Samsy, a market vendor and mother of three children. Fini is a fisherman. Every day he goes fishing along the Tonle Sap River and retails his fish at the shore, earning approximately USD 7.48 per day to cover his daily expenses.

As Fini’s house was built on the low part of the land and suffers from water in the rainy season, he is requesting a USD 1,200 loan to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground part of his house. In this way, he will be able to keep his house from flooding. He is very delighted and grateful for the loan support.

loans.use: to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground part of his house.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 55 years old and married with seven children.

Felipa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Felipa has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Felipa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jonave

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jonave works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Jonave is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

Jonave has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Julia is 47 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Julia has a business raising goats in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her goats.

Julia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Julia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her goats

loans.name: Junaire

texts.en:
Junaire is 31 years old and single with two children.

She earns a living by farming coconut and corn in the Philippines. Junaire is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Junaire has been farming coconut and corn for two years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Airen

texts.en: Airen runs a general store in their community to make a living. She has been doing this for more than three years and she earns well for the family. She had just joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. She always finds ways to augment their income. In the future, Airen wants to have a better source of income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime helps his wife run a general store for a living. He has been selling different kinds of grocery goods, earning well for their needs. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional canned goods and assorted grocery items for sale. Jaime wants to provide his family with a better life in the near future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and assorted grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mor, âgé de la trentaine, fait du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans, plus précisément en 1996 qu’il a démarré son activité. Son commerce consiste à vendre des céréales. Il se lève tôt et part dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour acheter du mil et de l’arachide à un prix abordable qu’il pourra revendre avec une marge bénéficiaire à ses clients de la ville. Le matin à 8heures, il place la marchandise jusqu’à 13heures  et deux jours après, il refait le tour pour récupérer son argent.
Il fait un renouvellement, et avec ce montant, il pourra acheter 3 tonnes de mil et d’arachide.
Mor est marié et père de trois enfants, dont il s’occupe grâce à son activité qui est rentable. Il peut désormais épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Mor a un toit pour son foyer, et avec son ambition, il aimerait en avoir d’autres et un véhicule personnel à sa disposition.
texts.en:
Mor is in his thirties and has been in business for more than ten years.  He started his business in cereal sales, in 1996.  

Mor rises early to visit the weekly markets and buy millet and peanuts.  He buys them at low, affordable prices and then resells them to his customers in town for a profit.  He sets out his merchandise from 8am until 1pm, and two days later, he revisits his customers to collect his money.  He will use his loan to buy three tonnes of millet and peanuts, for resale. 

Mor is married and has three children.  He supports his family thanks to his profitable business.  He can now also save money and improve the standard of food of his family.

Mor and his family have a roof over their heads.  In the future, he would like to expand his home and buy a vehicle for his personal use.

loans.use: to buy millet and peanuts ( 3 tonnes ), for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALANIKORO, un des villages de KEBILA, qui est une des Sous-préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur treizième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  MARIAM BAPIE (1ère debout à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt des condiments, qui seront  revendus au marché de KEBILA et en famille. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7 500FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi. Group are all married women, around 42 years old, with an average of five children.  They live in polygamous families in Dialanikoro, one of the villages in Kebila, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.

The group work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to constantly improve their businesses.  This will be their thirteenth loan with the field partner and the women intend to fully repay it on time.

Mariam Bapie (standing on the left of the photo) will use her loan to buy spices, seasonings and food ingredients.  She will sell her products at the market in Kebila and within her family.  She expects to make a monthly average of 7,500 francs CFA, and she will use her earnings to repay her loan, and help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy spices, seasonings and food ingredients.

loans.name: Nogaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 22 octobre 2013. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité et les environs. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaire. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Amy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants tous des garçons. Sa principale activité est le commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps. Elle achète de l'arachide 100 Kg à 400 F le Kg soit au total 40 000 F que je transforme en pâte d'arachide. Je peux avoir 04 seaux que je revends à 12 000 F le Kg. J'achète aussi de l'encens 40 Kg à 800 F le Kg que je revends à 1200 F le Kg.
Mes bénéfices réalisés vont me permettre de venir en aide à ma famille. J'ai un mari qui ne s'occupe pas de moi donc je suis dans l'obligation de me prendre en charge et de prendre en charge également mes enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 21 members and is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on October 22, 2013. Its members live in the same village or in the surroundings. The members stand by each other and get along well. Their main business is retail. 

Amy, age 45, is the one standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's married and the mother of three children, all boys. Her main business is retail, which she has been running for a long time.

She buys peanuts (100 kg for XOF 40'000, i.e. XOF 400 for 1 kg) that she transforms into peanut paste. She wants to buy 4 buckets of peanuts that she resells for XOF 12'000 per kg. She also buys frankincense (40 kg at XOF 800 per kg) that she resells for XOF 1200 per kg.

Her profits will enable her to help her family. Her husband doesn't provide for her, so she has to take care of herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and frankincense

loans.name: Carmen Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen  es socia del grupo de crédito Fe y Alegría desde hace 15 años, le gusta porque comparte gratos momentos en cada reunión con sus amigas. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que es Patrimonio Cultual de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos. Su gente es amable, gentil y cordial, aún conservan su cultura y tradiciones.
Doña Carmen tiene 60 años de edad, es viuda y ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, 2 ya son casados y viven independientes, sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, la casa en la que vive es  propia. 
La Señora Carmen desde hace varios años se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa de una gran variedad, también se dedica a realizar bordados  y tejidos como chompas. 
Su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de ropa para vender a su clientela. Su meta es conservar su negocio y crecer.
texts.en:
Carmen has been a member of the communal bank "Fe y Alegría" for 15 years.  She enjoys it because she shares pleasing times with her friends in every meeting.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which was designated a World Heritage Site in December, 1999.  It is surrounded by four rivers and its local people are kind, gentle and cordial, and still respect their culture and traditions.

Carmen, 60, is a widow and has four adult children, two of which are married and live independently.  Her single children work and help her out economically.  She lives in her own home.

For several years Carmen has been in business selling a wide variety of second hand clothing.  She also does embroidery and knits sweaters.

She plans to use the loan to buy clothing to sell to her customers.  Her goal is to stay in business and grow.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del grupo de crédito Fe y Alegría desde hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a establecer una muy buena amistad con todas las socias. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que es Patrimonio Cultual de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos. Su gente es amable, gentil y cordial, aún conservan su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora Rosa tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores de edad, que están casados y viven independientes, la casa en la que vive es el fruto de su trabajo.
Doña Rosa desde hace algunos años se dedica a producción y venta de verduras,cría pollos y cuyes, le gusta este trabajo porque es un negocio propio. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de verduras, pollos y cuyes para su negocio. Su meta es  arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Joy) group for four years.  During this time she has formed a good friendship with all the members. She lives in the city of Cuenca which was established as a World Heritage Site in December, 1999.  It is surrounded by four rivers and its local people are kind, gentle and cordial and still maintain their culture and traditions.

Rosa is 52-years-old and a single mother of two children who are both married, independent adults now. The house she lives in is the result of her hard work. 

For several years, Rosa has worked raising and selling chickens and guinea pigs and selling vegetables. She likes this type of work because it is her own business.  She will use the loan to buy vegetables, chickens and guinea pigs to sell.  Her goal is to fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mafall

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mafall, âgé de 63 ans, s’active dans le transport depuis des années déjà. Il a obtenu le permis en 1980 et a travaillé pour des particuliers pendant un certain moment, avant d’acquérir son propre véhicule.
Mafall est marié à deux femmes et a beaucoup d’enfants. Il vit en grande famille et ne gère que le petit déjeuner dans la famille. Il conduit lui-même son véhicule et travaille de 7h 30mn à 13h pour se reposer l’après midi. Pour ce crédit sollicité, il aimerait faire quelques réparations dans le véhicule. 
Son souhait le plus cher serai de retaper entièrement sa voiture et viser à en acquérir une autre pour augmenter le revenu.
texts.en:
Mafall is 63 years old, and has worked in transport for many years.  He obtained his driving permit in 1980, and worked for other people for some time before he could buy his own vehicle.

Mafall is married to two women and has many children.  He lives with his large family, but only manages to eat breakfast with the family.  He drives his own vehicle and works from seven thirty in the morning until one in the afternoon, and then he rests.

Mafall will use his loan to make several repairs to his vehicle.

His most cherished wish is to overhaul his current car and buy another, to increase his earnings

loans.use: to repair the vehicle he uses for public transport.

loans.name: Paula Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 9 y 8  años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Paula como buena esposa que es y para ayudarle a su marido  realiza el crédito para él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica  a la venta de pescado,  todos los días el se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta lugar donde compra el mejor pescado ya sea albacoras o picudos que son para vender por libras o también variedades de pescado pequeño los mismos que son de mucho agrado para sus clientes y por ser más económicos, el recorre la ciudad en un triciclo ofreciendo sus productos, lleva más de 18 años en este negocio el cual le da lo necesario para sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado en todas las variedades. Lleva más de 13 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan, son rápidos y muy necesarios para su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un carro para vender el pescado.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Calle América" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, famous both nationally and internationally.  It is also known for its famous straw hats.

Here is where Paula, 32, lives.  She is married and has three children, ages 13, 9 and 8.  The eldest is in middle school and the youngest two are in elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Being the good wife that she is and in an effort to help her husband, Paula is requesting a loan for her business.  She sells fish for a living and every day she travels to the city of Manta to buy the best fish she can, "albacoras" or "picudos", which she sells by the pound.  She also sells a variety of small fish which the customers like because they are less expensive.  She travels around the city on her tricycle offering her products.  For over 18 years she has been in business to help provide for her family. 

This loan is to buy a variety of fish.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 13 years and likes the fact that the loans are very quick to get and so necessary for her business.  Her dream is to have a vehicle one day to sell the fish.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Omar a séjourné dans la capitale où il a démarré son activité depuis plusieurs années (2002). Il est venu dans la région où il loge il y a de cela sept ans et a redémarré son commerce. Il a une boutique d’alimentation générale qu’il ouvre de 6h30mn à minuit ou au-delà. Il vend des denrées alimentaires : lait, riz, huile… et il pense diversifier  ses produits et services à l’octroi du financement qu’il sollicite.
Omar est marié et père de 2 enfants dont il a la charge. 
Omar veut devenir un grand commerçant un jour, diversifier l’activité et ouvrir d’autres espaces commerciaux
texts.en:
Omar went to the capital where he opened his first business several years ago (2002).  He moved to the region where he now lives, seven years later and established his business there.  

Omar runs a general food shop which he opens at 6.30 in the morning and closes at midnight, or even later.  He sells basic foods such as milk, rice and oil.  

He will use his loan to diversify the range of products and services he offers.

Omar is married, and is father to two children for whom he is financially responsible.  In the future, Omar would like to become a successful businessman, diversify his business and open other commercial enterprises.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, milk, rice and oil, to resell in his shop.

loans.name: Carlos Agusto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos  de 34 años de edad es soltero, no  tiene  hijos  que dependen de él, vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 07 años al negocio de venta de agua en porras,  molino de moler maíz, frescos, ropa, etc.
Don  Carlos  sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que viene a su casa a moler el maíz y también en la madrugada sale a vender el agua en su coche y ahora vende otros productos en su casa.
Don Carlos está solicitando el préstamo para compra de blusas, camisas,  frescos, detergentes y papel de baño, agua, etc. siendo estos su negocios  y espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar sus ingresos ya que está época navideña es muy buena, está muy contento de trabajara con Prisma.
Don Carlos es su sexto  préstamo que solicita y su deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante en su actividad generadora de ingresos uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Carlos, 34, is single and has no children.  He lives with his mother in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  For seven years he has been selling  water, soft-drinks, clothing, cornmeal, etc.

Manyof his customers are the friends and neighbors who visit his home to mill corn.  In the early morning hours he also goes out to sell water from is car and now he sells other products at home.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy blouses, shorts, soft drinks, detergents, toilet paper, water, etc. for his business.  He hopes the investment will allow him to improve his income over the Christmas season when sales are higher.  He his happy about working with Prisma.

Carlos is requesting his sixth loan and wants to continue working to get ahead.  One of his goals is to improve his business and quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, soft drinks, detergents, toilet paper, water, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Dolores María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de 13 que son gemelos y otro de 5 años  de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, para esto ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisuterías, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella sale a recorrer tres días por semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le da para los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos y en ocasiones para la comida  cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar bisutería, pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende en esta época del año. Lleva 5 ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Calle América" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, famous both nationally and internationally. It is also known for its famous straw hats.

Here is where we meet Dolores, 44, who is married and has three children, twins who are 13 years old and a five-year-old.  The eldest two go to school and the youngest is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Dolores is a very hard working woman who likes to help her husband with the household expenses.  To do this she sells all kinds of clothing and costume jewelry on a door to door basis.  She also sells from home when customers are in need of something.  She goes out to sell three times a week and does her transactions on a credit basis, collecting payment every 15 days.  For nine years she has been in business and it has allowed her to cover her children's education costs.  Sometimes she buys the food when her husband is out of work.

This loan is to buy costume jewelry, pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing which is what she sells most of during this time of year.  She has been in the communal bank for five loan cycles and enjoys it because she is able to get ahead with the loans.  Her dream is to have a bazaar.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry, pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es: El señor Evaristo vive en la población de Chancadora, junto a sus dos hijos y su esposa. Se dedica a la actividad agrícola en su propio terreno que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo durante la colonización, produce piña y otros productos de menor escala para el consumo familiar (yuca y arroz), la fruta la vende en el lugar de la cosecha a los comerciantes, pero debido a la alta demanda requiere tener productos de buena calidad para ello solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento de sus productos (desmalezado y fertilización), para obtener buenas cosechas y así incrementar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Evaristo lives in the town of Chancadora with his wife and two children.  He farms the cropland he acquired through much effort during colonization.  He produces pinapple and other items on a lesser scale for family consumption (yucca plant and rice).   At harvest ime he sells the fruit on site to dealers; and due to the high demand the produce must be of top quality.  He is requesting a loan to pay for crop maintenance (weed clearing and fertilization) to obtain good harvests and increase his income for the family's well-being.

loans.use: to carry out crop maintenance.

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Nafissatou, une dame de 55 ans, s’active dans la vente de poisson séché et fumé depuis 2008. Elle reçoit la commande avant d’aller acheter la marchandise, arrivée, elle livre et le reste, elle peut le vendre dans le marché à des revendeurs. Puisqu’elle a une clientèle exigeante, elle se procure le produit de meilleure qualité, ce qui maintient les clients et qui fait qu’elle est régulière dans ses déplacements pour se ravitailler.
Nafissatou est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui sont sa priorité. Elle s’occupe de leur éducation en leur payant des cours de renforcement. 
Madame Nafissatou ne regrette pas de faire du commerce car c’est grâce à cela qu’elle a pu acquérir un terrain. Et son objectif serait maintenant de le construire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nafissatou, age 55, has been selling dried and smoked fish since 2008. She takes her customers' orders before going pick up the products. Once she gets back, she delivers the orders and sell the remainder to resellers at the market.

Since her clientele is demanding, she gets hold of the best-quality products. For this reason and the fact that she get new supplies on a regular basis, she has many returning customers.

Nafissatou is married and the mother of four children, who are her number one priority. She takes care of their education by paying for support lessons.

Mrs. Nafissatou doesn't regret at all to be a merchant, because thanks to this business, she managed to buy a land lot. Her goal is now to construct a building on it.

loans.use: to buy dried and smoked fish to resell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Homme de 37ans, Kossi vit avec sa femme et leurs 05 enfants à Lomé. Trois sont sur les bancs d'école. Il est revendeur de profession et vend des matelas et des chaises en plastiques dans une boutique et il se fait aider par 01 personne. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, il sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises.Il espère améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et rendre son activité pérenne.
texts.en:
Kossi, age 37, lives with his wife and their five children in Lomé. Three of his children go to school. Kossi is a trained reseller, and sells mattresses and plastic chairs in a shop. He gets help from one person.

To better meet customer demand, he's seeking a first loan to buy more products. He hopes to improve the standard of living of his family and make his business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and plastic chairs

loans.name: Soad

texts.en:
Soad is a 51-year-old married woman from the city of Jabalia. She lives with her husband in a small house in the city. Soad's husband works as an employee in a public firm with a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

For the past four years, Soad has been working in sewing. She has an old machine and she does this work in her home. She is well-known in her area and she has her loyal customers.

Soad took a Murabha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her work. By taking this loan, Soad will be able to increase her productivity and provide a better quality product. 

Soad appears in the photo while she is working.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her work.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
La señora  Celina de  34  años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus hijos, no tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio de venta de camarón y pescado  su venta la realiza en la actualidad en su casa.
Doña Celina es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, compra  el producto al por mayor  y sus clientes llegan a su casa a recoger el producto para revenderlo,  vive  en la comunidad de San  Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Celina  está  solicitando el préstamo para compra de 200 libras de camarón y blusas, camisas, pantalones, etc. Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ganancias  porque esta época navideña es muy buena para vender este tipo de productos, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
 Doña Celina  su sueño para este nuevo  año es empezar a construir su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Celina, 34, lives with her husband and children.  She has been selling fish and shrimp for four years from the home they live in, although they do not own it.

Celina is a hard-working woman who is determined to get ahead.  She buys her products wholesale and sells them to the customers who visit her at home in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

She is requesting a loan to buy 200 lbs. of shrimp, as well as blouses, shirts, pants, etc.  With the support of the loan she hopes to improve her profits during the Christmas season when sales of these products are high.  She is happy to continue working with Prima.

Celina hopes to start building her house in the new year.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: To buy shrimp and blouses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tokachini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bishano est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires «Tokachini » entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 44 ans et mère de 10 enfants, dont 8 étudient et deux sont encore gosses. La cliente est  une vendeuse de farine de manioc. Elle fait ses activités dans le marché  de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari après  récoltes agricoles. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir  ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs, qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique,surtout ; pendant ce moment pénible de guerres à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bishano is a trader, experienced entrepreneur and member of the business group 'Tokachini'.  She is 44 years old, and mother to ten children, eight of whom attend school and two who are still too young.  Bishano sells cassava flour at the local market.  She started her business with the help of her husband and his agricultural business.  Later, she started working with the field partner, Hekima, and their loans.  Bishano has been running her business for ten years.

She will use her loan to buy two sacks of cassava flour.  In this way, she will be able to educate, clothe and feed her children.  

Bishano  would like to warmly thank Hekima for helping women entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the normal banking system, to become independent.  This is particularly important during this difficult time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of cassava flour for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dorca

texts.en:
Dorca is a young farmer who lives in Nyamira with her four children, all of whom are of school-going age. She produces and sells milk, eggs, maize, bananas and vegetables. She has been farming for six years. What she enjoys most about farming is planting maize because they usually do very well in Nyamira. Her challenges are insufficient funds and livestock diseases.

Dorca chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer low interest rates for their loans. During the MFI training offered by Juhudi Kilimo, she learned that they give loans to low-income earners in order to help them boost their lives. She says that this loan will help her to purchase poultry. This will lead to more egg production and thus more income for her family and thus improve their livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Meet Gladys who has just ventured into farming. She lives in Nyamira and has two children who are of school-going age. She has been farming for two years. She produces and sells milk, tea and eggs. She enjoys poultry farming because her chickens produce a lot of eggs for selling.

Gladys chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because the offices are easily accessible and it's easy to process the loans. She plans to undertake poultry farming because it will help her pay the school fees for her children and also improve her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maria Elvia

texts.es: María, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Lleva 10 años dedicándose a la venta de mercadería, vende ropa nueva como blusas, bóxeres, calcetas, cameras, cortinas, toallas, sandalias, pastas y  artículos para el hogar. Esta actividad la realiza en forma ambulante y por pedidos. Esta solicitando 5,800 Lempiras, para comprar mercadería como ropa, sandalias, pastas, y artículos para el hogar y aprovechar la temporada de navidad. Con esta inversión va poder tener mas producto y espera incrementar sus ganancias. Tiene como plan hacer crecer el negocio y que sus hijos puedan graduarse.
texts.en:
María, 36, is married and has two children.  She lives in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes.  She has always worked as a merchant and for ten years has been selling new clothing such as blouses, boxers, socks, bedspreads, curtains, towels, sandals, pastas and other home products.  She works as a street vendor and on an order basis.

María is requesting 5,800 HNL to buy goods such as clothing, sandals, pastas and home products to take advantage of the Christmas season.  With this investment she hopes to have more products to sell and increase her profits.  Her goal is to expand her business so her children can graduate.

loans.use: To buy clothing, sandals, home products, pastas, etc.

loans.name: Lomkpledji -Djokoto Vogan Group

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits de détails (mais, noix de palme pour la préparation du sodabi, paniers...) pour renforcer leurs activités, le groupement constitué de femmes et d'hommes sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit leur permettront de faire évoluer leurs activités et d'assurer un avenir radieux à la famille. Le responsable mr Koffi né en 1972 est père de 06 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Il est producteur de la boisson locale(SODABI) depuis 1993 et est aidée par 02 personnes.
texts.en:
The Lomkpledji-Djokoto Vogan Group is made up of men and women.  They are requesting this first loan in order to buy merchandise to improve their businesses.  They will buy retail products such as maize, palm nuts to prepare sodabi (a local drink), and baskets.

The group will use their earnings to develop their businesses and ensure a better future for their families.  

Koffi, the group representative, was born in 1972 and is father to six children, of whom three attend school.  He has been producing a local drink called sodabi since 1993 and is helped by two people.

loans.use: to buy various products for retail.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter plus de marchandises(œufs et boissons)pour revendre à ses clients, Amélé fait sa toute première demande à WAGES pour atteindre ses objectifs. Elle a démarré en 2009 et espère à l'avenir agrandir son activité tout en assurant le bien - être de la famille. Âgée de 39ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant de 14ans scolarisé.
texts.en:
In order to reach her goal and  buy more supplies (eggs and beverages) to resell to her customers, Amélé is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES.

She started her business in 2009, and hopes to expand it in the future, while ensuring the well-being of her family.

Amélé is 39 years old, married, and the mother of one 14-year-old child who goes to school.

loans.use: to buy eggs and beverages

loans.name: Mélé

texts.fr: Mélé  est une jeune femme de 33ans. Elle est commerçante de profession et revend des pagnes et des bijoux dans la zone portuaire depuis 2011. Le second crédit sollicité à WAGES lui servira d’acheter des marchandises (pagnes et bijoux) afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mélé, age 33, is a trained retailer. She's been reselling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and jewelry in the harbor area since 2011.

She's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, that she will use to buy supplies (pagnes and jewelry) in order to better meet her customers' needs.

She wants to reinvest in her business by opening a store, and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and jewelry

loans.name: Asma'

texts.en:
Asma' is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Asma' is 19 years old and from Nablus. She lives with her husband in a small house. 

Asma's husband works in a small bakery that he owns. He has had the bakery for eight months, and it is a good business and provides a good income. 

Asma' took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new oven for her husband's bakery. By taking this loan, Asma's husband will be able to increase his productivity and his income.

loans.use: to buy a new oven for her husband's bakery.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 58-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah. He is the father of two sons and two daughers. 

For the past five years, Sulaiman has worked using a tractor he owns. He works with many farmers in his city. It is a good business, and he earns a good income. However, his tractor needs to be repaired, and he does not have enough money to fix it.

Sulaiman has requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair his tractor so he can get back to work. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his tractor so he can get back to work.

loans.name: Jovelin

texts.en:
Jovelin is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like cream, chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, etc for her general store business.

Jovelin has been in this business for four years. Jovelin earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Jovelin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like cream, chips, bread, canned goods and eggs.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  Gregoria   de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, sus clientes le visitan en su casa.
Doña Gregoria con la ayuda de sus dos hijas  trabaja haciendo tortillas todo los días de lunes a domingo, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene más de tres ciclos de trabajar con Prisma y  a demostrado buen  comportamiento de pago en sus préstamos y además desea negociar con ropa para esta época de navidad.
Doña Gregoria está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña, cal, blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. Con el apoyo de este crédito desea comprar por mayor la materia prima para realizar su negocio y  comprar ropa nueva para vender a sus clientes un producto adicional a sus tortillas.
Doña Gregoria de esa forma espera tener mejores ganancias, su sueño es mejorar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 44, lives with her husband and three children in their own house.  For four years she has been selling tortillas to the customers who visit her home.

With the help of her daughters, Gregoria makes tortillas every day, Monday through Sunday.  She is a hard worker and has borrowed loans through Prisma on three occasions, with a good payment record.  This Christmas season she also wants to sell clothing.

Gregoria is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, lime water and blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, etc.  With the support of the loan she wants to buy more raw materials for her business and buy clothing to sell as a new product line.

She hopes to earn more profits.  Her dream is to improve her house and quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime water, and blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Casildo

texts.es: El señor Casildo vive en concubinato y tiene 2 hijos, compro un terreno urbano en el que vive actualmente, y un lote agricola en el cual se dedica a la produccion de piña y platano. Debido a que sus ingresos disminuyeron por el bajo costo de sus productos afectados por cambios climaticos y plagas,  solicita un credito para terminar la construccion de su vivienda  ya que quedo paralizada por falta de recursos economicos. Actualmente su productos se encuentran en buen estado asi que podra venderlos y obtener ingresos por ellos, su principal objetivo es trabajar arduamente para cubrir todos los gastos y mejorar las condiciones en las que vive su familia.
texts.en: Casildo is in a common law marriage and has 2 children. He bought a city lot where he lives now, and an agricultural lot where he grows pineapple and plantains. Due to the fact that his income went down because of the low price of his crops, affected by weather changes and pests, he is asking for a loan to finish building his house. He had to stop due to a lack of resources. Right now, his crops are doing well so he will be able to sell them and get income from them. His main objective is to work hard and cover all of his expenses and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia. His father works in construction, but he does not have a stable income.
